loans.name: Thành

texts.en:
Thành works in agriculture farming food.

Thành is 38 years old and he is married with 2 children.

Thành  lives with 2 dependents in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thành faces in his life is not having hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Thành Nguyễn hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Alvie

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Alvie learned of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and the wide savings, credit, and insurances that PMPC offers. 

Alvie is an office employee and an average wage earner. She invests in a rice farming business in Ozamiz City. She wants to have additional income aside from her regular salary. She tried her luck and borrowed a loan to venture into rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Alvie  feels she owes her good fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, Alvie availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Alvie wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer to sustain her family's needs.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is married and has one child who attends school. Her husband is an IT Officer. She is from Cavite, Philippines and works in a garment factory that has partnership with CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Lulu is a Human Resource Officer. She is responsible for providing support in the various human resource functions, which include recruitment, staffing, training, development, performance, monitoring, and employee counseling. She also provides advice and assistance to supervisors and staff. This may include information on training needs and opportunities, job descriptions, performance reviews, and personnel policies of the Council.

One of the main dilemmas for employees like Lulu is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses; they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Lulu is asking for assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously borrowed from CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She will use the loan to sustain her personal business and also for emergency cases.

Lulu wants to become a successful employee and entrepreneur. She hopes to give her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for her personal and business needs and other expenses.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình operates a food stall, selling rice noodles. She is 56 years old and married, with four children. Bình lives with no dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Bình has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Gulhotun

texts.en: Gulhotun is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1987. Gulhotun is married, but does not yet have children. She works in a state establishment. Her work experience amounts to more than two years. She fulfills her work honestly and with high quality. Gulhotun and her husband very much want to have children and therefore they are going to be treated. At the same time, they do not have the money for the treatment. Gulhotun is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase medication for treating her husband and herself. This loan will help them to have children and be happy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the certified seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed for vegetable production

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing/fish vending business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing/fish vending business

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Мамлакат проживает в городе Худжанд. Худжанд расположен на северной части Таджикистана. Мамлакат умная, добрая и трудолюбивая. Ей 53 года. Мамлакат замужем за электрика. У них в браке имеется сын. Он находится на заработках в России, но его жена и трехлетний ребенок остались с Мамлакатом и ее мужем. Сын не забывает о своих родственниках и старается предоставить финансовую помощь, но нелегко одному работать в чужой стране.
   Мамллакат занимается продажей национальных лепешек на рынке города. Не большой бизнес идет стабильно, но Мамлакат хочет расширить малый бизнес, чтобы принести больше дохода в семью. За счет заемных средств она приобретет из пекарни больше лепешек для продажи. Мамлакат надеется собрать средства и открыть собственную пекарню. И к этой цели она идет неустанно.
texts.en:
Mamlakat resides in the city of Khujand. Khujand is located in the northern part of Tajikistan. Mamlakat is clever, kind and hardworking. She is 53 years old. Mamlakat is married to an electrician. They have a married son. He is working abroad in Russia, but his wife and three-year-old child remain with Mamlakat and her husband. Their son has not forgotten about his relatives and tries to send financial support, but it's not easy to work alone in a foreign country.

Mamlakat sells national flat cakes in the city market. The small business is going stably, but Mamlakat wants to expand the small business in order to get more income for the family. With the borrowed funds, she will acquire more flat cakes from the bakery for sale. Mamlakat hopes to collect funds and open her own bakery. And with this goal, she is unrelenting.

loans.use: to purchase flat cakes for future resale

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат, так зовут эту женщину на фотографии. Значение ее имени в переводе с таджикского означает любовь, и действительно она соответствует своему имени, так как всегда излучает от себя любовь и доброту. 
Мухаббат живет со своей семьей в северной части страны, в районе Спитамен. Ее муж тракторист, сама Мухаббат вместе с дочерью занимается шитьем. В возрасте 61 года Мухаббат собирается параллельно начать новый бизнес. Ее интересует бизнес откорм и продажа скотов. Для этого у нее есть коровник во дворе дома и другие условия для ведения этой деятельности. На запрашиваемую сумму кредита Мухаббат хочет закупить двух голов быков хорошей породы и корм для них. Благодаря этому кредиту она сможет начать бизнес и принести в дом дополнительный источник дохода для улучшения благосостояния семьи. Мухаббат верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is the name of the woman in the photograph. The meaning of her name in Tajik is love, and she really lives up to her name since she always radiates love and kindness.

Muhabbat lives with her family in the northern part of the country, in the Spitamen region. Her husband is a tractor driver and Muhabbat herself together with her daughter does sewing. At the age of 61, Muhabbat intends to start a new business in parallel. She is interested in the business of fattening and selling cattle. For this, she has a cowshed in her yard and other conditions for conducting this kind of activity.

With the requested loan amount, Muhabbat wants to buy two head of steer of a good breed and feed for them. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to start a business and bring into the home an additional source of income for improving the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase two head of steer of a good breed and their feed

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a factory worker, age 37. He lives in GMA, Cavite, Philippines with his wife and two children. He has been in the service for almost a year now through the aid of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Richard works as a garment manufacturing supervisor. He directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters, operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Richard, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Richard is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to any loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in returning the money since the loan payments were being deducted every payday. He looks forward to your positive response and any assistance from you will surely be of great help. He will utilize the loan to pay for his housing expenses and also to provide other needs of his family.

Richard desires to give his family a better life and he also hopes for his children to finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, provide quality jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for housing expenses and other needs of his family.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda is 27 years old and has one child. She is fromin Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She earns an income to improve her family conditions from rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She earns about 36,700 KHR per day. 

Chenda is the leader of her two-person group. She requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes to harvest a bigger yield than last year.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Louange Group

texts.fr: Bahaya est commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Louange», âgée de 36 ans, mariée à un commerçant et mère de 7 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché central depuis 5 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 7 ballons  de friperies pour accroitre son activité.  Elle  commença avec de fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bahaya, age 36, is a merchant and member of the Louange business group. Her husband is also a merchant, and they have 7 children who all go to school. 

Bahaya has been selling used clothing at the central market for 5 years. She initially launched her business with capital received from her husband. She is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster her activity through the purchase of 7 bales of second-hand clothing.   

Her goals are to buy some land and to support her children’s education.  

Bahaya wishes to thank Hekima for helping small entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 7 bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 43 years old and married with ten children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roquelina

texts.es:
Roquelina es de una familia muy luchadora y trabajadora, lucha mucho para poder alcanzar el objetivo que tiene, de poder estudiar y salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y con ello pretende poder ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud, además de que tambien podrá ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios.
En vistas a poder seguir mejorando su vida a traves de sus estudios, pide este prestamo, que le permitirá poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Roquelina comes from a very hard-working family. She has worked very hard to achieve her goals of getting an education and becoming successful. She is currently getting her nursing degree, with which she will help others with something very important: their health. She also hopes to be able to help support her family with more income, once she receives her degree.

Roquelina is requesting this loan so that she can continue her studies by paying her tuition, through which she will achieve a better life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Ее зовут Инобат. Ей 55 лет. Она живет в одном доме с мужем, сыновьями и невесткой на районе Спитамен. Ее муж пенсионер, а сыновья мастера по производству металлических пластинок. Инобат почти 20 лет занимается скотоводством. Она покупает телят и бычков, откармливает их и после определенного времени перепродает их с наценкой на скотном рынке. Инобат просит кредит, чтобы купить пару скотин для увеличения поголовья скотин, сохранения малого бизнеса и увеличения дохода. Инобат полагается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Her name is Inobat. She is 55 years old. She lives in one home with her husband, sons and daughter-in-law in the Spitamen region. Her husband is a pensioner, and her sons are master producers of sheet metai. For almost 20 years, Inobat has been engaged in raising livestock. She purchases calves and steer, fattens them and then at the appropriate time resells them at a premium at the livestock market. Inobat is requesting a loan to purchase cattle in order to increase her livestock count, to retain the small business and to increase income. Inobat is relying on this support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her livestock count, to retain the business, and to increase income.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
57-year-old Rodolfo is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. He is married and has one grown child. Rodolfo operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household needs like bread, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings, toiletries, and rice. He has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years now.

Rodolfo is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy a variety of groceries, a few sacks of rice, and beverages. This purchase will fill his store with a wide array of goods that will attract more customers. The loan will help Rodolfo generate higher sales that could eventually sustain the family's daily expenses.

Rodolfo hopes that with additional capital, he can continue making a better profit out of his business and be able to purchase a tricycle that would be very useful in transporting his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries, a few sacks of rice, and beverages

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is 55 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Valeriana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Valeriana has been farming rice  for 25 years and earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de l’habillement, de savon et de charbon de bois.
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAH, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de riz, de la farine boulangère et des condiments sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente des plats se fait en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en: The LAIDOU group is made up of married women, who are on average 35 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met each other through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They are in food service and also sell clothing, soap, and charcoal. The women of the LAIDOU group are on their second group loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clientele, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The client, MAH, second person from the right, is illiterate, and currently runs a food-serving business. She plans to buy one sack of rice, baking flour, and spices on the spot from wholesalers. She sells her dishes for case at the market to a mixed clientele. She foresees earning a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food service

loans.name: Avaghuma V Group

texts.fr: Regine est commerçante et membre du groupe de crédits «Avaghuma V», âgée de 58 ans, mariée à un vétérinaire et mère de 7 enfants tous  étudient. Elle est vendeuse de pagnes dans une gallérie de la ville depuis 5 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 100 pièces de pagnes pour accroitre son activité.  Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Regine, age 58, is a merchant and member of the Avaghuma V group. Her husband is a veterinarian, and they have 7 children who all go to school. 

Regine has been selling pagnes out of a local shopping mall for 5 years. She initially launched her business with capital received from her husband. She is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster her activity by purchasing 100 units of pagnes.   

Her goals are to buy some land and continue to support her children’s education.  

Regine wishes to thank Hekima for helping small entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 100 units of pagnes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fanta (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 kg de viande et 10 kg de banane à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fanta  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 26 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Benkadi group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 31 years old and have four children. They all live in the Hamdallaye de Ségou neighborhood (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met each other through neighbors, relatives, marriage, and their local businesses. They run small businesses selling clothing and serving food. In the goal of augmenting their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. 

Mrs. Fanta (second woman standing from the right in the photo) runs a food-service business in the neighborhood and its surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 kg of meat and 10 kg of bananas in Ségou. She sells her products for cash and often for credit at the market to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Fanta hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 26,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for the little needs of her children and to increase her business funds. She hopes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy meat and bananas

loans.name: Celeste

texts.es:
Celeste es de la ciudad de pilar, sus familiares son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, tiene 3 hermanos, a quienes ella quiere servir de ejemplo el día de mañana. Su meta es culminar sus estudios exitosamente, ser una gran profesional y darle a su hija un futuro mejor, de aquí a cierto tiempo me veo trabajando en la profesión que ella escogió, que es la de análisis de sistemas.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Celeste is from the town of Pilar. She comes from a very hardworking and driven family. She has three siblings for whom she wants to become an example in the future. Her goal is to successfully complete her education, get a job in her field and give her daughter a better future. "In some time, I envision myself practicing my chosen profession, which is as a systems analyst," she says.

She is requesting this loan to pay her college feels so that she can keep working towards her goal.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sabali vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier pelengana sud de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de fruits et légumes, de lait et chaussure. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kafouné (la 2ere  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de concombre à Ségou et à Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kafouné  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20  000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the Sabali group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 35 years old and have four children. They all live in the Pelengana Sud neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met each other through neighbors, relatives, marriage, and their local businesses. They run small businesses selling fruits, vegetables, milk, and shoes. In the goal of augmenting their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. 

Mrs. Kafouné (second woman standing from the left in the photo) is a big seller of fruits and vegetables in the neighborhood and its surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of cucumbers in Ségou and Bamako. She sells her products for cash and often for credit at the market and at home to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Kafouné  hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for the little needs of her children and to increase her business funds. She hopes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Cuc, born in 1955, is a Kinh person. She lives with her husband and her two children in the Mai Son district, in the province of Son La.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and livestock breeding. Her family’s annual income is just enough to cover their living expenses.

After gaining knowledge on a project to raise pigs for pork, many people are successful with this model. Cuc and her husband want to access a loan to have more capital to invest in buying a breeding pig and food for it. She hopes that M7 Microfinance Institution Limited will support them by lending them the money.

Cuc hopes she can access this loan from the Institution. She is confident that she and her husband will apply this new pig-raising model successfully and that her pig herd will grow up fast and bring high income to her family. The couple and their children will work hard to earn money to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig and food for it

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en:
Hon, born in 1991, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her son in the Mai Son district, in the province of Son La.

Her family has farmland given to them by her parents. She and her husband have been planting coffee trees, but due to a lack of capital for investment, they haven’t been able to make full use of their land area, which has led to low crop yields. This season, she wants to access a loan to invest in planting more coffee trees and rice.

She hopes this loan will help her family to be in condition to invest in cultivation well and that her family will have greater yields in the coming harvest season.

loans.use: to invest in planting more coffee trees and rice

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Long before Deborah even moved to San Diego, she started using Herbalife products and experienced first-hand the benefits they provide. She lost almost 20 pounds while taking Herbalife meal-replacement shakes and instantly became an evangelist for the product, becoming an independent distributor while working full-time.

After working as an assistant to the Brazilian Ambassador to the US in New York for several years, she moved to San Diego to be near her family, but had a hard time finding work. She ended up taking a few different jobs and worked at restaurants, while growing her Herbalife business. 

Her Herbalife mentor, a very successful local distributor, eventually suggested that she open a health center featuring Herbalife products. She took his challenge to heart, and in March opened a small shop where she sells meal replacement shakes and teas, and also holds regional Herbalife meetings, health workshops, and several different exercise camps. She has invested quite a bit of her own money into the business and is already able to bring in consistent revenues.  

She recently sought out a Kiva loan to help purchase additional inventory to ensure she always has an adequate stock of product for her growing health center. She also used a portion of her funds to upgrade her signage and for marketing expenses.

As her business grows, she hopes to inspire other Herbalife distributors to open their own centers around the city and continue to spread the culture of health and wellness that she is so passionate about.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and upgrade her shop signage.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUISSEME est un groupe de l’association DAMBE de SEGUESSONA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de KADIATOU  qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SEGUESSONA, qui est l’un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU commune rurale dudit lieu dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : prêt à porter et balle de friperie.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  Prêt Solidaire. 
KADIATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  SEGUESSONA, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de prêt à porter et 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à  SEGUESSONA et OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
DJIGUISSEME is a group within the DAMBE de SEGUESSONA association. It groups together women who met each other through relatives and neighbors. They are on average 29 years old. They are married and have, on average, four children. They run different businesses, like buying and selling clothes, as does KADIATOU, who is the person standing to the far left in the photo. They all live in large traditional families in SEGUESSONA, which is one of the villages in OUELESSEBOUGOU, a rural commune in the prefecture of KATI (KOULIKORO region, Republic of Mali). They have been running small businesses for several years and are well sought-after in their clothing businesses: ready-to-wear and second-hand clothing. In their concern with satisfying the growing need of their clientele, the group members decided to integrate Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. They are on their first group loan.

KADIATOU, who is the president of the group and well known in SEGUESSONA, excels at selling clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 ready-to-wear pieces and one bundle of second-hand clothing. She stocks up at OUELESSEBOUGOU and on-site at wholesalers’,  and sells her clothing in SEGUESSONA and OUELESSEBOUGOU at retail, for cash or credit to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI est un groupe de l’association DAMBE de SEGUESSONA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales  à l’image de FATOUMATA  qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SEGUESSONA, qui est l’un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU commune rurale dudit lieu dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente de céréales : maïs et mil.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  Prêt Solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  SEGUESSONA, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de mil.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses céréales à  SEGUESSONA et OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
TIESSIRI is a group within the DAMBE de SEGUESSONA association. It groups together women who met each other through relatives and neighbors. They are on average 31 years old. They are married and have, on average, four children. They run different businesses, like buying and selling grains, as does FATOUMATA, who is the person standing to the far right in the photo. They all live in large traditional families in SEGUESSONA, which is one of the villages in OUELESSEBOUGOU, a rural commune in the prefecture of KATI (KOULIKORO region, Republic of Mali). They have been running small businesses for several years and are well sought-after in their grains businesses: corn and millet. In their concern with satisfying the growing need of their clientele, the group members decided to integrate Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. They are on their first group loan.

FATOUMATA, who is the president of the group and well known in SEGUESSONA, excels at selling grains. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of corn and three sacks of millet. She stocks up at OUELESSEBOUGOU and on-site at wholesalers’, and sells her grains in SEGUESSONA and OUELESSEBOUGOU at retail, for cash or credit to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Reynato

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Reynato has been engaged in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. He is 45 years old and has three school-going children.

He aims to improve his business and to generate sufficient income to sustain the necessities of his family and finance the education of his children. 

Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail himself of an additional loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional pigs to raise. He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 58 years old, married, and has five children. 

Vicenta is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Vicenta has been raising livestock for ten years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Noong Het 5 Group

texts.en:
Tuan is a 33-year-old married woman with two sons who are 16 and 14 years old. They have lived in an old Thai traditional house for 13 years. Their life is quite stable, but Tuan's sons will graduate from high school and go to college in the very near future, which will cost a lot of money.

Despite it being a costly expenditure, Tuan is very firm in her intention to send her sons to college, to enable them to have a good education and a bright future. For that reason, Tuan and her husband have worked very hard in agricultural activities such as cultivating rice and vegetables and raising pigs, chickens and other livestock.

Like many men in the village, Tuan's husband also works for local construction employers to have more earnings. Tuan said that she wanted to expand her business by raising more pigs, so she applied for a second loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets.

Though there are plenty of difficulties ahead, she believes that Anh Chi Em's financial and socio-economic support will help her overcome the tough times.

In the picture, Tuan stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan is 38 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province with her five children. She earns a living by growing rice on one-and-a-half hectares of land. She also works for others for a fee to earn additional income. Chhan is requesting her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. Her goal is to get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Horonata

texts.en: Horonata is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling food in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more items to sell. Horonata has been in this business for 12 years, and supplements her income by selling fish and raising and selling pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help from loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal-retailing. Beverly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase beauty products, like body lotion, perfume, shampoo, and other personal items.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, like body lotion, perfume, shampoo, and other personal items.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en: Maria Luz is 50 years old, married and the mother of six children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including snack foods, coffee, detergent, canned goods and soft drinks. Maria Luz has taken out and repaid eleven loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running her general store for nine years and earns additional income by raising livestock. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора женщина в возрасте 39 лет. Замужем и имеет 2 детей. Нигора живет в сельской местности и работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Муж Нигоры ездит на заработки в Россию и работает там строителем. Сын Нигоры работает в магазине автозапчастей и помогает родителям чем может. Так как сын у Нигоры вырос и должен скоро жениться, Нигора решила сделать ремонт дома и с этой проблемой обратилась в «Арванд» финансовой поддержкой. На данный момент Нигора не располагает финансовыми средствами так, как работа на поле прекращена из-за сезонности. Она хочет купить строительные материалы. Нигора благодарит «Арванд» за помощь в предоставлении кредитов малоимущим слоям населения сельских местностей.
texts.en: Nigora is 39, married, and has two children. She lives in a rural area and works on a small farm. Her husband is currently working in construction in Russia and her son works in an auto parts store and helps his parents as much as he can. Because her son is grown up and will be ready to get married soon, Nigora decided to repair the house and applied for a loan with Arvand for help with this problem. She currently does not have the financial resources because it is not the season for farm work. She wants to buy building materials. Nigora thanks Arvand in advance for their help in providing credit to poor rural areas.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana viene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, su meta es terminar sus estudios, tener un trabajo seguro y ganarse la vida dignamente, con el propósito  de ayudar a sus padres  y hermano..
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería Agroindustrial, profesión por medio del cual podrá sentirse útil y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus útiles escolares, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juana comes from a modest and hardworking family. Her goal is to finish her studies, have a secure job, and earn a decent living in order to help her parents and brother. She is studying for an Agroindustrial engineering degree, an occupation by which she can feel useful, and be someone in life. 
She is requesting this loan to invest it in paying for her school supplies, so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of school supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Laguna, Philippines. Dante, her partner, is a tricycle driver, and they have four children. Teresita has been employed at a garment factory in Cavite for almost two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Teresita is a production worker. She is responsible for garment making processes from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Teresita, is the difficulty of balancing their salaries and family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has caused many of them to become heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Teresita is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she has had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments are being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response, and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan for the payment of her motorcycle.

Teresita wants to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Soy is 52 years old and a mother of six children. To support her family, she grows rice on two hectares of land and works as a construction worker. She has been involved in these businesses for ages. 

This is Soy's first cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. 

As the leader, Soy will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle and expand her rice farm, so it is larger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rasoola

texts.en: Rasoola is 55 years old, married, and lives with her husband and five children in Lahore. Her son earns a living by selling rice wholesale; he buys the rice from harvesters for a low price and sells to retailers in Lahore. He has been buying various kinds of rice for many years and sells large amounts to a long list of reputable retailers with whom he has had a long relationship and who speak highly of him. His business is seeing an increased volume of new customers and he wants to buy more rice in bulk to handle this rapid increase in demand. In this way he will be able to increase his monthly income, savings and take good care of his children. Rasoola extends her thanks to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for their support.

loans.use: to help her son buy rice.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, vive con su esposo y su suegra, esta empezando a trabajar, pero anteriormente tambien estaba trabajando en las ventas.
Está estudiando la carrera de bioquimica, a traves del cual quiere poder abrise camino a la vida profesional y ganarse con ello su sustento.
Pide este prestamo para el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por un mejor dia a dia.
texts.en: Shirley is from the city of Caaguazú and lives with her husband and mother-in-law. She is just starting to work, but has also worked previously in sales. She is studying for a degree in biochemistry, through which she wants to be able to make her way into the professional world and earn her living. She is requesting this loan to pay for her fees, in order to be able to continue her studies, striving for better day by day.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
Nin is a 62-year-old woman with seven children who lives in Kampong Cham province. 

She grows rice as her main source of income and works as a construction worker to supplement her income. She can earn income about 38,900 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can improve her family's lifestyle and expand her farmland..

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 27 years old and married with two children who are in school.

Arlyn is in the fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials for fishing. She has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa is 48 years old, married and the mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling dried fish in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell. Basilisa has been in her current line of work for four years and in the future would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Wabelita

texts.en:
Wabelita, a married woman,  works hard to support her family. She has had a food vending business for 5 years.

Wabelita requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fish, meat, noodles, spices, and vegetables.

Wabelita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  fish, meat, noodles, spices, and vegetables.

loans.name: Akhia

texts.en:
Akhia is 43 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. Her husband is a professional driver  and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years and is able to  meet the family's expenses. The rickshaw is in need of maintenance to keep it functioning. 

Akhia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will provide a smoother ride and better transportation service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Akhia gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Phallang's Group

texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old, Phallang is a rural villager from the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are too young for schooling. She has earned a living by growing rice for 16 years. 

This is the second loan for her with VisionFund. The past loan has helped her better support her living conditions. She is now leading her group to request a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and pay for plowing the field. She hopes to get more crops from her rice farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Norm Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years, Norm is widowed and lives with her children in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has six children, two of whom are dependent on her. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items, which she has been doing for 37 years. She can earn about USD 7 per day from the current business and is able to save about USD 4 each day for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Norm with VisionFund. She used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production and better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a 56-year-old  married woman.

Candida has grown rice for 5 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She and has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Candida would like to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chan Thim Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of one child, Chan Thim lives in a village in the Ou Reang Ov district of Cambodia. To support the family's living, she grows rice and her husband works as a construction worker. She also works as a paid worker to supplement the family’s need. She has been doing these businesses for 10 years. 

Chan Thim is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor fees for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is a local villager in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old, and a married mother with two dependent sons. She has been a rice farmer for nineteen years; she supplements her income by running a grinding business. The current business earns about KHR 33,000 KHR per day.  

This is the second loan cycle for Sokhoeurn with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and to fix her grinding machine. She hopes this loan will enable her to gain more crops from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Khun Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Khun is a 50-year-old mother of eight children. She is a farmer in the local area who grows rice and cassava to make a living. Having been in the business for 32 years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 30,000 KHR and is able to save about 15,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

This is the seventh loan for Khun with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Khun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and cassava in a timely way so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ratha Group

texts.en:
Ratha is 28 years old and married with three children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee for seven years. The current business earns her family about 32,000 KHR per day to feed their children. 

Ratha has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to make more crops from her cassava growing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cassava

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en: Ton, 53, lives with family members in a rural village of Battambang Province. Struggling to raise her family's living condition, she grows rice as her single source of income. For Ton, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland

loans.name: Noong Het 6 Group

texts.en:
Son, 40, lives with her husband, son, mother-in-law and two sibling-in-laws, in a 21-year-old small house in a remote village. She had other 3 children but they all died because of disease and accident. Her son is 18 years old and has dropped out of school to support the family. Son's family grows  rice and cassava; they also raise pigs, chickens and ducks. Son's husband sometimes works for local construction company to earn additional income. 

Son understands that her son will be in the vicious circle of poverty if he doesn't have a good job so she wants to send him to vocational school so that he will have technical skill to have earnings from that. For that reason, she has continued working so hard and this is the second loan she has taken out from Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets and food for pigs. The previous loan was also used by her to invest in pigs, which brings satisfaction to her. She said that thanks to the loan and technical support from the Program, she finally could conduct her business plan and hoped that she could afford to send the son to vocational school and provide better for the family. 

In the picture, Son wears a white shirt and stands in the first row, the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for pigs.

loans.name: Sam Ul's Group

texts.en:
Sam ul, 45, is a mother of three children living in Kampong Cham province. She grows rice to earn an income to improve her family's living conditions.  She also works in construction. 

This is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can expand her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Prei

texts.en:
A father of three dependent children living in Siem Reap province, Prei is 41 years old. To support his living, he grows rice on a 1-hectare area and charges batteries. Moreover, he earns extra income via bicycle and motorbike repairing. 

For Prei, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his loan to buy a new machine for charging batteries. He hopes that he can earn more income to keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for charging batteries.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Giang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Giang, born in 1984, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her parent-in-law, her husband, and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and livestock breeding. The new season for rice is coming. Her family wants to buy a buffalo to support smooth plowing. 

Giang wants to borrow a loan from M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (M7-MFI) to buy a healthy buffalo to assist her family’s field work, to be less hard and difficult, and to bring a high crop yield.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to support smooth plowing.

loans.name: Roen Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Borseth district of Kampong Spuer province, Roen is a 25-year-old mother of five children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others. They have been in this business for several years, earning about 35,000 KHR per day.

Roen’s group consists of five members who live in the same village. She is a third cycle client with VisionFund and she successfully paid back her loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Roen, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to raise more healthy crops and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru:
Бахринисо добрая женщина из маленького солнечного района Кубодиён. Ей 47 лет. Она живет с сыновьями. Бахринисо работает уборщицей в службе спасения.
   На данный момент дом Бахринисо срочно нуждается в ремонте. И она с сыновьями решила до прихода холодов за короткий срок отремонтировать жилище, чтобы пережить зиму, но достаточной суммы денег не имеют, чтобы начать ремонт и купить стройматериалы. Бахринисо выход видит только в получении кредита. Она надеется на финансирования с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Bahriniso is a kind woman from Qubadiyon, a small sunny region of Tajikistan. She lives together with her sons and works as a janitor at the local  Rescue Services department.

At present Bahriniso’s house is in need of urgent renovations. She and her sons have decided to renovate their home quickly before the temperatures drop in order to be able to make it through the winter. However, they are lacking funds needed to start the renovation works and buy construction materials. Bahriniso sees a loan as her only solution. She is hoping to receive financing from you.

loans.use: to renovate her home and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a farmer who raises  hogs to have an additional source of income. He is 37 years old and has three children, all attend school. 

Due to the high cost of goods and school fees, he needs to improve his business to earn a higher income. He needs 30,000.00 PHP to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs,  and material to improve the pigpen. 

He hopes to  improve his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs, and material to improve the pigpen.

loans.name: Cresanta

texts.en:
Cresanta is 55 years old and married with two children. Cresanta works very hard to provide for them.

Cresanta has run a general store for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  She sells  shampoo, detergent, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, and cereals. 

In the future, Cresanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buygroceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married with six children, one attends school.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF  to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nilda has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income raising livestock.

Nilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment, a cotton candy machine and plates for her catering service.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 49 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband owns a small firm with a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories. He employs laborers and pays daily wages. He needs different categories and qualities of raw material. He has been awarded a large contract  but does not have enough cash to buy additional raw material to continue his manufacturing. 

Kalsoom has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband to buy raw material for his molding machines. She  looks after a large family and takes care of her children's school fees, diet, and health. For these reasons, she needs a large income and her husband is the sole provider.

Kalsoom is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for manufacturing.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 55-year-old married woman living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore. She is a retailer of rice; she buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells in her locality. She buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel, etc.

Naseem has been in this business for many years and has many customers who like to buy rice from her in large quantities. In this tenure she has built up positive relationships within her community.

With an increase in new customers and demand, she wants to buy rice in large quantity, so that she can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way she would be able to increase her monthly income and savings as well.

Naseem is the mother of seven children; she has grown old now and hopes that her children would support her in old age. She praises your honorable support and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for reselling by herself from her home.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en: A woman living in Kampong Cham Province, Sat is 42 years old and a mother of three children. Now she needs to support two schoolchildren. For her family, she can earn income to improve conditions via cassava and rice growing. She can earn about 33,500 KHR per day. This is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. Sat will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can raise her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia has run a general store for 5 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods and shampoo.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the family's future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and shampoo.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Eang is 26 years old and the mother of a young child. She struggles to provide for her family via rice cropping on a two-hectare area and by working for others for a fee to earn more income. Her business earns her about 42,800 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm so it yields a bigger harvest than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreytom's Group

texts.en:
Sreytom is a 21-year-old woman with 1 child, they  live in Kampong Cham province. 

She grows rice in a two-hectares area as her main source of income and is a construction worker to supplement her income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of 2. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed. 

She hopes to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Phen is a 36-year-old woman with two young children.  They live in Kampong Cham province.

She grows rice in a two-hectares area and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her loan. She leads a group of two to apply for a  new loan. As the group's leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and seed. 

She hopes to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Tahmina's Group

texts.en:
Tahmina is a 29-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruit  in a central bazaar and  from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

Tahmina's husband chose this business because it is profitable and provides a stable income. People use fresh fruit every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made from fruit. He wants to increase his inventory in order to sell the maximum amount of fruit  and earn a profit.

Tahmina applied for a loan for her husband to purchase more fruit and increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits.

loans.name: Sâm

texts.en:
Sâm has grown   food for 10 years.  She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.
Sâm supports 3 dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She requests a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Sâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bric to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Lucila has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a housewife and a mother of six children; she requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. 

Rani's husband is the main earner of the family and earns an income driving the rickshaw. Unfortunately, the current rickshaw has completely broken down and he can not use it. This has resulted in Rani's children skipping school due to lack of resources. Hence, Rani wants a loan to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again.  This would enable her to send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun is a 36-year- old woman with five children. She is a local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, 

She needs to support her  three school-aged children and grows rice as her single source of income.  She earns 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and leads a 3-member group. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's  living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 35 years old and has three children.  They live in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has run a general store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap,and  biscuits. He manages his household necessities from his own store.   His relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an impressive  tone and wins the trust of others.

 Due to his behavior and tone, he has built a good customer base. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relationships,  his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan for her husband to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergent, and biscuits. 

Shazia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to meet the family's demands. Shazia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iitems for general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals and groundnuts.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has a services business in the Philippines. 

Melba requested a PHP 13,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her reflex services.

Melba has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her reflex services.

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyet, the Kinh person, is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family has a very difficult situation. Her family’s monthly income is based on her little salary. Her husband is hired to work for other people, but the income is too low. Her children are not as fortunate as other kids; they are always sick and have to go to the hospital very often. That is the reason why she cannot save any money from working and doesn’t have enough money to pay for their children’s medical treatments. 

Knowing about the credit program of M7 Microfinance Institution Limited, she and her husband applied for a loan from the Institution to pay for their children’s medical treatments.

She expects that with this loan, her children will have successful medical treatments so they can have a better life. Then, she and her husband can feel secure in mind and have more time to work to get money to repay the Institution on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s medical treatments.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Шодигул по профессии швея. Ей 40 лет. Она живет на Файзабаде, это поселок городского типа, расположенный в 50 км восточнее города Душанбе. Шодигул живет в городе вместе с мужем и двумя детьми. Ее дети уже взрослые. Сын находится в России на заработках, а дочь помогает Шодигул в ее швейном деле. Вот уже 17 лет как Шодигул продолжает заниматься шитьем. Она берет заказы на пошив женских платьев национального стиля. Эта услуга востребована в городе и у Шодигул всегда достаточно заказов. Сейчас Шодигул хотела бы расширить свой бизнес. Она берет кредит для купли новой модернизированной швейной машинки, с помощью которой темп ее работы ускорится. Шодигул надеется таким образом увеличить доходность своего дела. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Shodigul is a seamstress by profession. She is 40 years old and lives in Fayzabad, a village located 50 kilometers east of the city Dushanbe. Shodigul lives with her husband and two children, who are already grown. Her son is working in Russia and her daughter helps her with the sewing business. It has been 17 years since Shodigul started sewing. She takes orders for traditional women's dresses. This service is in demand in the city and she always has plenty of orders. Now Shodigul wants to expand her business. She is taking out a loan to buy a new, modernized sewing machine, which will help her work faster. Shodigul hopes this will make her business more profitable. She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy beauty products for her business. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy animal feed and medicine. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicine.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is age 40. She is living with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, and as a hawker he can easily reach near to the people. The people like to buy fruits at their doors instead of moving to the market. 

Due to his fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased, and around noon his stock comes to an end.

Shehnaz feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is receiving this loan for her husband so that he can buy fruits in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. She wants to save the excess profit so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fruits in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them.

loans.name: Jenemar

texts.en:
Jenemar has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. 

Jenemar is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to make a decent home for the family and have a wider space for her carenderia business to have a higher income in the family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her sari sari and meats and a sack of rice for her eatery.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a woman with 2 children aged 4 years and 11 years. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a fast growing area and her primary customers are ladies.
