She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of hair products for use in the salon. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a happy family and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of hair products.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be dedicated. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. 

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area suitable for farming, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves. 

Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will become successful. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, a married mother of two, has been operating a retail business selling groundnuts for seven years. Her enterprise is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Teresia will use this Kes 20,000, her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, to buy more stocks of groundnuts. Her business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groundnuts

loans.name: Zelia

texts.en:
Zelia is a married mother of seven children. Since 2006, she has been the owner of a motorcycle  transport business that she started with her own working capital of $3,700.00. It is well-patronized, and she earns a good income. Zelia also raises animals such as buffalo, cows, pigs and chickens.

Zelia is requesting a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She wants to buy items such as tires, spark plugs, gasoline, and tools for motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy tires, spark plugs, gasoline, and tools for the motorcycles,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a septic tank with toilet.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be focused. 

Lilian operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area suitable for dairy farming and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of milk. 

Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow

loans.use: buy more stocks of milk

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 46-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and equally responsible for all of them. She belongs to an ultra-poor family. That is why she cannot afford their educational expenses, so that most of her children are doing jobs as laborers for daily wages. 

One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material, such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc., to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he will be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods, and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Naseem is very glad, and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods, and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a widowed woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be industrious. 

Sara operates a retail business where she sells firewood. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are both men and women. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stocks of firewood. 

She hopes that in the future, she will start another busines. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of firewood.

loans.name: Hajra

texts.en:
Hajra, aged 41, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, and this is the reason for her working extremely hard - to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home, and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft, so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives, and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

Hajra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha, Teresia and Aisha currently have no access to electricity and use kerosene lamps to get light in the evening. Therefore their children cannot get light enough to study in the evening. In addition to that, they get exposed to indoor pollution and pay more than $5 every week for kerosene.

A solar system would help them to save money and live a better life, but it requires a high upfront investment. A Kiva loan could help them to get progress in their life.

loans.use: to buy a solar-powered system to electrify her house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC after she learned she can get financial assistance for her chosen business. She raises and takes in hogs for her hog raising business. 

Victoria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her hogs to make an income after selling them. This will help her to expand her business since she is planning to buy more piglets and to concrete the pig pen. 

Victoria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively so that she can provide a better living and good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her pigs.

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his work.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with four children. With all four children currently in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cereals, vinegar, etc. to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cereals, vinegar, etc. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cereals, vinegar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Milagros has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Alongside her food selling business, Mariamu operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in this business. Her previous loan helped her to expand her business and improve her living standards.
 
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mirembe Get Out Of Poverty Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 38-year-old woman who is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She is a first-time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd and a resident of Gayaza town. 

She is a member of the Mirembe Get Out of Poverty women’s group. She has borrowed a loan of UGX 500,000 through the group for the purpose of buying feeds for her piggery.

She is so grateful for the support given to them as low-income earners. Her future plans are to borrow money to buy a plot of land to enlarge her small farm, educate her children and also take care of them. 

The lady sitting on the picture is a UGAFODE staff member.

loans.use: To buy feeds for the piggery

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, married to a farmer and they have five kids. As a farmer, she has always experienced hardships like plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and any other agricultural commodity to sufficiently provide for her family. 

Gloria landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. Farming is her main source of income. Gloria came to PMPC just in time for the working capital she needed. Now, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer to increase the crop yield on her rice farm. This will help give her farming income a big boost. 

She is always looking forward for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase the crop yield on her rice farm.

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en:
Ruperto has signed up his membership with PMPC and accessed the needed capital to start up his pork and chicken barbeque business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like him. Ruperto is able to turn the tide in his favour and has made good sales these days. 

Ruperto wants to take advantage of his good fortune. Recently, he accessed a loan to buy raw materials such as chicken and pork for his barbeque. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as chicken and pork for his barbeque

loans.name: Dionella

texts.en:
Dionella is 52 years old and married with three children.

Dionella earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Dionella is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dionella has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Dionella is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Twubakane Cb Group

texts.en:
The group is called “TWUBAKANE,” which means "let us rise up and work" in English. The members of the group sell different items, and they wish to scale up for a better future for the businesses. 

Violette is a group leader, aged 27 years old. She is married with four children between 1 and 7 years old. 

Violette has sold from a shop for seven years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more soap, sugar and rice for sale. The profit from the business will be used to increase their savings.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 33 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time, her beauty products have been diminishing and, this time, she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Shumaila has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetic products, such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, and lotion.

Shumaila wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Shumaila thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetic products, such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, and lotion.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married and needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

He sells general merchandise in a retail shop, such as sugar, salt, and soap.  He built up rentals to supplement his income generation.  He started the business to meet the family needs, though inadequate capital hinders his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is the age of 60, living with her nine children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a mobile shop for a couple of years, and is earning sufficient income. Her son can troubleshoot the mobile; he also sells the mobile accessories such as chargers, body, data cable, etc, and provides the recharge facilities for different networks. 

Nowadays there is a lot of increased demand for mobile accessories and for recharge; sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he already has spent his all savings on household expenses. 

Therefore, Suriya requested a loan for her son so that he can empower himself and can buy additional accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility. 

Suriya thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories and recharge for her son's mobile's shop.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a butcher shop and works five days a week. He started it with a hope of getting money for his family. The challenges he faces are price changes and poor roads, which hinder him while transporting cows. Besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Christopher needs a loan to buy cows for slaughtering and selling.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering and selling.

loans.name: Rudo Group

texts.en:
Louie is a member of Rudo group, based in Mufakose, a high density suburb of Harare, Zimbabwe. Louie is into the business of wholesaling snacks to tuck-shop and stall owners around her. She also sells on a retail basis to school children. Louie is a widowed mother of three children, of whom 2 are still school going. She is the sole breadwinner, educator and provider for her children. Her business is her sole source of livelihood. 

Louie was into the business of selling hardware essentials, until she developed a knee tumor which left one of her legs disabled. This made it hard to remain in the hardware business as carrying heavy things became difficult for her. Despite her illness and subsequent disability Louie carried on doing business, but changed to wholesaling snacks, biscuits and sweets. 

With her loan from Thrive Louie plans to restock bulk products so that she increases her sales and market share. She plans that in future she moves to a bigger shop wholesaling mass quantities and has dreams of owning her own car or truck, making transportation of her goods easier.

loans.use: To expand her snack wholesale business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
32-year-old Josefina is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has three children, ages 16,14, and 10 years old. 

Josefina engages in a buy and sell business. She sells umbrellas and other household paraphernalia. In addition to that, Josefina engages in a food vending business. She sells frozen goods like longaniza (pork sausage), embutido (cured sausage) and tuba, or coconut wine. 

Due to a lack of capital, to finance her sources of income, Josefina is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more supplies of longaniza (sausage) and additional capital to buy several sacks of rice, for the start-up of her rice retailing business. This will help her get a higher income and hopefully provide her children with proper diets and quality education.

Josefina hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of longaniza (sausage) and additional capital to buy several sacks of rice

loans.name: Nicer

texts.en:
Nicer is 27 years of age and a resident of Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Philippines. She is married with 3 kids and her husband is a fisherman.  They have a little fishing business from which they earn a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Nicer and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 14,900 loan to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories to have more catch to sell.  They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, supporting their financing needs in their chosen business. 

Nicer has a strong determination that with her husband's help she can provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories to have more catch to sell.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to provide tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies to increase production.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear. Arlene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Active Ladies Group

texts.en:
Lizzy is a 30 year old member of the Active Ladies group. She lives in Glen Norah, a part of the Harare Province. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a self-employed plumber who sells plumbing materials and installs them.

Lizzy has been a tailor since 2007 and has managed to survive off the tailoring business since then. She specializes mostly in interior decoration. She has been helping her husband with household obligations. 

Before coming to Thrive, business for her was low. This was because she did not have enough capital to buy materials to meet her demand. She also lacked business management skills that she obtained from the training offered at Thrive. After receiving her first loan, Lizzy was able to double her revenue. With her savings she also purchased an industrial sewing machine for her business and this has enabled her to achieve better efficiency and effectiveness.

With the Kiva loan, she hopes to get more materials and an assistant so she can be able to take on bigger jobs as her business is expanding. She wishes to one day have her own house where she can live with her family.

loans.use: To employ an assistant for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kweterana Kyabatega Farmers Group

texts.en:
Tegrasi lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is married with 6 children. He grows maize and beans to earn a living.

Tegrasi is a member of Kweterana Kyabatega group, where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan. He dreams of constructing a permanent house for his family. However, pesticides, infertile soils, and price fluctuation affect his business.

Tegrasi would like to acquire a loan to prepare his garden (weeding, ploughing, and buying fertilizers) in preparation for the next season.

loans.use: to prepare his garden (weeding, ploughing, and buying fertilizers) in preparation for the next season.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia, who lives in Suai, has operated a retail shop since 2009, a business she started with her own working capital of $250.00. She earns a good income every day, as the shop is well-patronized. She also raises animals such as cows, pigs and chickens.

Anastacia is requesting a loan of $ 1.500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add more items to her store such as shampoo, soaps, toothpaste, balm, soy sauce, slippers, cooking oils, sardines, detergents, biscuits, etc. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, soaps, toothpaste, balm, soy sauce, slippers, cooking oils, sardines, detergents, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El Socio José continua dedicándose a trabajar como  técnico dental, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pon cada día a su trabajo, él socio continua elaborando prótesis que generalmente los vende a los odontólogos siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio José solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para elaborar prótesis.
El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member José is continuing his work as a dental technician.  He enjoys working at his job, which is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He continues making prosthetic devices that he generally sells to dental surgeons, and in this way he is getting his family ahead.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of materials to make the prosthetic devices.  He is a part of the communal bank "El Templo del Inca", in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to make dental prosthetic devices.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 43-year-old married man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He quarries pozzolana (cement raw material) and at the same time grows food crops like banana and cow peas. The challenge he faces is weather changes that affect the roads when he is transporting the pozzolana to market. Besides that, he has hopes of educating his children to higher levels of learning. Wilson needs a loan to pay labor for quarrying pozzolana.

loans.use: to pay labor for quarrying pozzolana (cement raw material)

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 38-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes and bananas, in addition to retailing. He faces challenges of weather changes and inadequate capital. However, he hopes to construct a permanent house. 

Moses needs a loan to rent a tomato garden, so he can take care of it to reap & sell the tomatoes.

loans.use: to rent a tomato garden, and take care of it so as to reap & sell tomatoes.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy emprendedor y trabajador, lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, a pesar de su corta edad siempre está pendiente que todos sus seres queridos porque son el principal motor de su vida, es por ello que está trabajando como operario en una empresa textil. En sus tiempos libres le gusta ayudar a su mamá en una pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo han abierto, es un joven muy soñador, alegre y amable.
Juan en estos momentos necesita una computadora para poder hacer sus trabajos pendientes, es por ello que utilizará el crédito para poder comprarla, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad porque con ello podrá mejorar su labor diaria. Más adelante su gran meta es poder emprender su propio negocio para así poder sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising and hard-working young man.  He struggles every day to help his family move forward. Despite his young age, Juan is always thinking about all of his loved ones, because they are the engine that drives his life.  It is for this reason that he is working as a machine operator in a textile company.

In his spare time, he likes to help his mother in a small shop, which she opened with a great deal of effort.  Juan is a cheerful and friendly young person with ambition. Currently, Juan needs a computer to do their pending jobs, which is what he will use the loan to buy. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity because with this, he will improve his daily work. Later, his ultimate goal is to start his own business in order to help his family succeed and to give them a better future.

loans.use: To buy a computer to be able to do his work better.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey needs a credit facility to buy land. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda and is married with three children, ages 7, 4, and 1. Two attend school.

Godfrey sells sodas and beers in a bar. He started the business to support his salary income. He desires to develop his bar through expansion and by use of his little profits he gets from the bar sales, but competition is still a challenge.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma, 39, is married and a mother of seven children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession, and provides transportation services in Lahore. He also provides pick and drop services to students. He now wants to buy another rickshaw to rent out and earn additional income. 

Najma is the group leader of her group, and is the one raising her hand in the picture. She has applied for a loan to help her husband buy a rickshaw. They will pay it off with the income generated from the new rickshaw and later start saving. 

They want to provide their children better living standards and are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is age 48, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, and she is the mother of seven children. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Parveen and both of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her elder daughter has been helping, and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Parveen wants to buy a new juki machine (industrial sewing machine) for her elder daughter, so that she can contribute with her income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new juki machine for her daughter. 

She wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. Parveen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a juki machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her mid 30s, is single with three children who are still in school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 06 am to 04 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy the out of stock items for her mama lishe (local restaurant) business and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients for her mama lishe.  She dreams of owning a grocery and buying a frige.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group, "Bega kwa Bega", which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her mama lishe.

loans.name: Cristo Moreno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Matilde ella es soltera y tiene 39 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de cosmeticos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Cristo Moreno" communal bank.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco Province of the Cusco Region.  

Maria Matilde is a member of this group.  She is single and 39 years old.  She works in her restaurant where she makes a variety of dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups and stir-fried beef.  She works from 8am to 5pm.  She has run her restaurant for the past 10 years and it has gone very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant.

She is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

The other members of the group have businesses selling clothing, selling cosmetics, selling groceries, as well as restaurants.  They are grateful for those who are part of making their dreams come true through this forum.  They are committed to complying with the loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: purchase cooking products such as: chicken, meat and vegetables

loans.name: April

texts.en:
22-year-old April is a resident of Balasan, Iloilo. She is a single woman. She engages in buying and selling of scrap materials like iron, bottled mineral water, cans, galvanized iron, and many others. She has been buying and selling scrap materials for almost three years now. 

April is asking for a loan to buy a variety of scrap materials like bottled plastic water, a piece of iron, and many others. This will augment her income, thus helping her family to have abundant food and good living conditions. 

April hopes that with an additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of scrap materials like bottled plastic water, a piece of iron, and many others

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Francisca has been raising pigs for five years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gitari

texts.en:
Gitari is a farmer who lives in Thuita village in the Central Province of Kenya. He has a wife he has been married to for 15 years, and the product of their love is three children, the eldest being 30 and the youngest being 6. He has been farming for over a decade. He keeps two cows and six hens that give him milk and eggs for food and to sell. He also grows tea, vegetables, and banana. To supplement his main income sources, Gitari also trades cereals. 
The cereals business has really picked up. His name is out there, and the demand is increasingly becoming too much for him to fulfill. Gitari is seeking a loan to replenish his cereal stock. 

He will use the loan to purchase more cereals in order to fulfill the overflowing demand. The money he makes from the business will repay his debt, cover his costs and overheads, provide basic needs for his family, and pay for boarding education for two of his kids.

Gitari is very excited about this opportunity. Through your loan, he is going to grow his business and be a better provider for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Tweyombeke Nyamiringa Group

texts.en:
Nelson is 38 years old, married with five children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He started his business to support his family and pay for expenses such as his children's school fees and welfare. He wants to educate his children and expand his business, despite the challenges he faces of weather variations, a poor transport network and poor roads. 

Nelson is a member of Tweyombeke Nyamiringa, in which members guarantee each other to secure a loan. He wants a loan to buy cereals to sell, like ground nuts and maize.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas lives in Suai, and she is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

She has a shop of clothes in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as T-shirts, long skirts, short skirts, shorts and other things to sell. Domingas opened her business in 2008 with her working capital of $450. She is earning a good income every day because she is selling in the center of the market, so many people are interested in her clothes; so very happy to do her business. 

And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to get a good management for her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, long skirts, short skirts, shorts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: Apollo is a 36-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time earns a salary. He faces the challenges of price fluctuation of agricultural products and - like other farmers - the unpredictable weather changes. Besides that, he has hopes of having an educated and healthier family. Apollo needs a loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Luis, el socio continua dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio continua vendiendo comida típica de la región, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,aceite,papas entre otros.
 Luis está muy agradecido con KIVA y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Luis continue to dedicate himself to his restaurant.  He has been in this business for a good amount go time, and it has gone well for him thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He continues to sell traditional foods from the region.  He wishes to continue working so that he can keep supporting his family.

Luis is seeking a loan to purchase rice, oil, potatoes and other ingredients.  Luis is very grateful for Kiva, and he is committed to making the payments on time.  He belongs to the "El Templo del Inca" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: purchase rice, oil, potatoes, etc...

loans.name: Giraldo Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio Giraldo pertenece al banco comunal EL TEMPLO DEL INCA, él  socio tiene 27 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar el  servicio de odontología, él socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales como amalgamas entre otros.
El socio Giraldo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica la cual le da los ingresos para mejorar en su atención y profesión, y porque esta ayuda le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes
texts.en:
Giraldo belongs to the "El Templo del Inca" communal bank.  He is 27 years old, had one sone and is single.  The members spends his days providing dental services.  He has worked as a dentist for many years, and it has gone well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work everyday.  He hopes to continue working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is seeking a loan to purchase materials such as fillings, among other items.  Gerald is very grateful for Kiva's help in his business, which provides him with an income to improve his business.  This support will allow him to provide better service to his clients.

loans.use: purchase materials such as fillings among other things.

loans.name: Guine

texts.en:
Guine has always dreamed of opening her shop for direct selling items like Avon and Natasha products to support her two children. She used her loan to buy more product items for her direct selling.
 
Guine has big plans for her business: to put up a display store. She is now on her way to saving a portion of her new profits to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy more product items for her direct selling business

loans.name: Kipkoech

texts.en:
Kipkoech is a farmer based in Kaboi village in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is married to a lovely 37-year-old wife, and they have a sweet boy still in infancy. Kipkoech may be new to fatherhood, but he is a farming veteran. He has been doing this work for two decades. The vegetables and tea that he grows on his one acre farm provide him with a reliable income. He also sells milk and eggs from the animals he keeps.
 
Kipkoech enjoys looking after his cow. He also spends a lot of time on his tea farm, picking tea leaves, something he admits is very strenuous but his eyes are riveted on the dollar. He makes good money selling tea to factories. The problem is that he has limited land to expand this operation.
 
Kipkoech is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 for leasing land and buying fertilizer. The additional land he will acquire through a lease agreement will give him enough space to plant more tea. Since he will be scaling up, he will also rely on the loan to buy farm inputs that do not come cheap, such as fertilizer. 

When asked how this loan will be of benefit to his family, Kipkoech replied, "My nuclear family will have a chance to enjoy better standards of living because of enhanced cash flows."

loans.use: to lease land and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Pantaleo

texts.en:
Pantaleo is a fifty-eight-year-old, hard-working man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in a retail business, where he earns a living, although he also carries out agriculture to earn himself some extra income. He started this business to improve his standards of living. He faces the hardships of competition and inadequate capital to meet high demand, while his dream is to diversify his business.

Pantaleo is requesting a loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, soda and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 28-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and at the same time works as a farmer. He has the big challenge of limited capital, but still has hopes of educating his children to higher levels of learning. David intends to use this loan to help him pay for labor for weeding his onion farm.

loans.use: To pay for labor for weeding his onion farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 32 years old and has two children. She used to have her own small shop where she sold small things like soap, vouchers and bread to the villagers. She had received a solar entrepreneurship training from African Solar Rise and now wants to build up a retail store for solar energy products. A loan would help her to fulfill her dream and bring light into her village.

loans.use: to build up her own retail store for solar energy products

loans.name: Felex

texts.en:
Felex is a 47-year-old hardworking married man with three children ages 10, 4, and 2 years old; they are living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock as his main source of income, though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. He started this business with the intention of earning a living and improving on his standard of living. 

Felex hopes to expand his businesses and have a modern farm, though he faces a challenge of pests and diseases and of lack of capital to meet the increasing demands.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more cattle for the farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for the farm.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres de San Bartolo
Este dúo está formado por Doña María Llanuaria, ella tiene 63 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el  mercado de la terminal desde ya hace varios años, y su otro puesto lo tiene en el Mercado de su localidad, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de frutas y verduras para seguir surtiendo más su negocio,agradece profundamente su apoyo en su negocio ya que se a superado en gran manera.
texts.en: “Dúo Mujeres de San Bartolo” (Women of San Bartolo Group. This group includes Doña María Llanuaria.  She is 53 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables at the terminal's market in Guatemala for several years. María has another sell spot that is located at Market in her locality. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables.  This will allow her to continue stocking her business. She is deeply grateful for the support for her business since it will help it to succeed in a great way.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Resineros De San José De Cañas Group

texts.es:
El representante del grupo de resineros del San José de Cañas, se llama Rogelio, es casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar. Tiene 3 hijos - Rogelio, Belén y Valeria. Es abuelo de tres nietos, quienes viven con el, cuando sus nietos no están en la escuela le acompañan al monte y aún cuando para ellos es como un paseo,  Rogelio aprovecha para familiarizarlos en el oficio de la resinación. 

Para Rogelio la resina ha sido su único ingreso durante toda su vida, ya que por un tiempo trabajo en la sierra de Arteaga, a seis horas de su casa, como instructor de resineros. Este préstamo lo utilizará para establecer con su familia las primeras plantaciones de pinos resineros en la región. Con las plantaciones resineras planea dejarle a su familia la seguridad de tener un ingreso  económico permanente para que las futuras generaciones puedan vivir en mejores condiciones familiares. Rogelio, está orgulloso de su trabajo,  ya que el oficio de resinero le da la posibilidad de valerse por si mismo y ser el patrón de su propio negocio. 

El saber que hay gente alrededor del mundo que está dispuesta a ayudarle con su proyecto lo hace sentir contento y les gustaría compartirles a todas estas personas que está dispuesto a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo. En su opinión la resina apoya al medio ambiente, ya que permite conservar los montes (las  tierras) con bosques, para él los pinos son la vida. Como en cada actividad hay retos que se tienen que enfrentar y Rogelio platica que lo más complicado para él, son los largos recorridos que tiene que hacer para recolectar la resina.  Sin embargo, le gusta más platicar de las cosas positivas, por lo que considera que el clima de la región donde vive favorece la producción de la resina y es una oportunidad para que todos los integrantes del grupo puedan usar el préstamo para plantar 32,000 pinos resineros y poco a poco incrementar la superficie de los huertos resineros.
texts.en:
To find out more about how Ejido Verde is working to create opportunity for indigenous populations watch this video Rogelio is the representative for the group “Resineros de San José de Cañas”. He is married and his wife takes care of their home. He has three children: Rogelio, Belén, and Valeria. Rogelio is also a grandfather to three grandchildren who live with him. When they are not in school, Rogelio's grandchildren will accompany him to the mountain, which seems like going for a walk to them. However, Rogelio takes advantage of this opportunity to teach them about the trade of resin tapping.

For Rogelio, resin is the only source of income that he has known his entire life. One time he worked as a resin tapping instructor in the Arteaga Mountains, which is six hours away from his house. This loan will be used by him and his family to establish the first pine resin plantation in the region. By having these pine trees, his family will be left with permanent financial security for future generations that will enable them to live under better conditions. Rogelio is proud of his work. The vocation of a resin tapper gives him the opportunity to support himself and also become the boss of his own business.

Knowing that there are people from all over the world who are willing to help with this project gives him a sense of happiness. He would like to share that feeling with everyone who is willing to work with great enthusiasm. In his opinion, the resin industry helps the environment because it preserves the mountains, the land, and the forests. For him, these pine trees are his life. With any business, there are challenges that have to be faced. Rogelio says that the most complicated challenges for him are the long trips that are required to gather the resin. However, he would rather enjoy talking about positive things, such as the climate of the region that is favorable to resin production.

All group members will use their loan to plant pine trees. Collectively, Resineros del San José de Cañas will plant 32,000 pine trees, which will gradually increase the area of the pine forest.

loans.use: to buy and plant resin producing pine trees. The resin will be harvested annually, providing income for many years

loans.name: Amos's Group

texts.en:
Amos is 56 years old and a father of 7; he owns a mill in his village and has a very big extended family to care for. He is very excited with the project considering the fact that many farmers in his village including him will be lifted out of poverty by this lending initiative.   

With this loan, Amos hopes to store more palm oil this season so as to increase his income; this will help him to meet up with his family responsibility, especially that of paying school fees and feeding of his family. 

Amos and his group members thanks all those who lovingly contribute to their loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and a mother of 7; she lives with her husband in a Okwu-Ubaha, Nigeria. She is very hard working woman and ever ready to support her husband who cares for a very large extended family. She is a very happy woman. Even thought she never had the opportunity for any formal education, her dream is to have at least 3 college graduates from her family. This is a very big challenge for such a low income individual in Nigeria, but she is determined to achieve it. 

A portion of this loan will help her purchase palm fruits during this session and increase her production of palm oil-based products so as to meet up with her goals.

loans.use: to purchase and process palm fruits

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a hard-working man with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells milk, matooke and timber, and at the same time earns a salary. He faces the challenge of low capital; besides that, he hopes to have good retirement benefits. Godfrey needs a loan to buy land where he can put up a nice building for his family.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 39 years old, married with 3 kids, and a resident of San Vicente Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. He earns a living through a sari-sari (variety) store. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years, and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase sari-sari store items for resale. Allan deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase sari-sari store items for resale

location.town: Dipolog-San Vicente, Dapitan City,Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 18 años, nació en la ciudad del El Alto del departamento de La Paz y actualmente vive en Santa Cruz de la Sierra con la familia de su hermana. Ella comenta que lo más difícil fue dejar a sus padres, ya que extraña su hogar y le preocupa no estar cerca de ellos para poderlos apoyar; pero entiende que al tomar esta decisión significa tener una buena formación profesional, crecer como persona y tener mejores oportunidades laborales ya que de esta manera  podrá ayudar económicamente a su familia y logrará darles una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor motivación es cumplir el sueño de sus padres, que es ver a sus hijas profesionales ya que ellos no lograron terminar el colegio.

Sandra eligió estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, pues piensa que los conocimientos que adquirirá le permitirán obtener un buen puesto de trabajo en una empresa o emprender su propio negocio. Ella considera que lo que la hace diferente de los demás es el gran deseo que tiene de superarse, pues tiene el apoyo de su familia que la impulsa a salir adelante. 

Sandra se siente muy agradecida con el Programa y con aquellas personas que confiaron en ella y le están dando la oportunidad de ser profesional y así alcanzar sus sueños que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Sandra, 18, was born in the city of El Alto in the department of La Paz, and currently lives in Santa Cruz with her sister's family.  She commented the hardest part was to leave her parents, because she misses home and is worried about not being near her parents to help them.  Though, Sandra understands that making this decision means she can get a good professional education, grows as a person, and more work opportunities.  In this way she'll be able to help her family financially and give them a better quality of life.  Her greatest motivation is to fulfill her parents dream which is to see their daughters to become professionals.  Her  parents weren't able to finish high school.

Sandra decided to study commercial engineering because she thinks that the knowledge she'll acquire will allow her to get a good job in a company or start her own business.  She thinks what makes her different from others is her big desire to improve herself, because she has the support of her family as a motivation to get ahead.

Sandra's very grateful to the program and to those people who had faith in her and are giving her the chance to be a professional.  In this way she can realize the dreams she wants so much.

loans.use: to pay for her program in commercial engineering

loans.name: Jines

texts.en:
Jines, who is 27 years old, is very hard-working and responsible with his household obligations, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who plants rice. 

Jines wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to buy farm inputs and to pay for labor in land and seedbed preparation for continuous rice production so that he can continue to put food on the table in his home.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Zamirajon

texts.ru:
Замирачон живет в районе Спитамен, на северной части республики. Она продавщица и занимается продажей конфет и сладостей на протяжении 8 лет. Ее торговая точка расположена на центральном рынке района.  
Замирачон замужем. Она является матерью одного ребенка. Ей самой в этом году исполнилось 28 лет. Она очень целеустремленная женщина и сейчас стремится расширить свой малый торговый бизнес. Замирачон просит кредит для приобретения нового товара, чтобы разнообразить ассортимент конфет и сладостей и привлечь больше клиентов.   
Замирачон в будущем хочет открыть собственный магазин для продажи своего товара. Она всегда верит в успех своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Zamirajon lives in the Spitamen region located in the south of Tajikistan.  She turned 28 this year, is married, and is the mother of an only child.  Zamirajon is a goal-oriented woman trying her best to grow her small retail business.  She sells candy and sweets for a living, and has done so for the past 8 years.  She has a spot in the central market of Spitamen where she sells her goods, and is seeking a loan to buy an assortment of sweets and candies to increase the variety of her offering and attract more customers.  Zamirajon has faith in her business's ability to succeed, and hopes to open her own store one day.

loans.use: stock up on a variety of candies and sweets

loans.name: Dania Marieta

texts.es:
La socia Dania sigue dedicándose a ejercer su profesión  de contadora, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cu7al le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de papeles, lapiceros, un organizador de ficheros entre otros.
La socia Dania está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a mejorar  su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Group member Dania is continuing to practice her profession of accounting. She has worked as an accountant for a long time, which is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her work every day. The member wishes to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

Dania is asking for a loan in order to buy papers, pens, a file organizer among other things.

Dania is very grateful to the investors for helping her to improve her professional activity, which will allow her to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy papers, pens, a file organizer etc.

loans.name: Vilma Concepción

texts.es:
Vilma de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado de educación básica, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 tiene hogar aparte y solo su hija esta con ella. Su esposo es agricultor y solo él y su hija viven con Vilma.

Vilma es comerciante en pequeño, tiene 2 años de tener un negocio de venta de tortillas y pupusas en su casa, aprendió cuando trabajó ayudándole a una amiga que se dedicaba a la venta de comida.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 3 juegos de mesas plásticas con sus respectivas sillas y para pagar un documento que le dé derecho a un puesto de venta en el mercado local para trasladar su negocio. Vilma espera obtener buenos resultados con su negocio para después ofrecer otros servicios.
texts.en:
Vilma, 47 years old, studied until the 2nd grade of elementary school. She is married and has 3 children. 2 of them have separate homes and only her daughter is with her. Her husband is a farmer and only he and their daughter live with Vilma.

Vilma is a small merchant. She has had a business in her home selling tortillas and pupusas for 2 years. She learned while she worked, helping a friend who made a living selling food.

The loan will be used to buy 3 plastic table sets with their respective chairs and to pay for a document which gives her the right to move her business to a sales stall at the local marketplace. Vilma hopes to obtain better results with her business to later offer other services.

loans.use: to buy 3 table sets with chairs and a sales stall at the marketplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic products such as beans, rice etc. to stock her shop.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de los que solo 3 estudian, ella estudió hasta 3° grado de educación básica y por motivo de la distancia del centro educativo tuvo que dejar de estudiar y se dedicó  a la elaboración de hamacas. Con ella viven sus 4 hijos u su esposo que es agricultor, solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Además de elaborar hamacas, también cuida animales domésticos, cría gallinas en su casa y también ayuda a su esposo en los oficios agrícolas cuando tiene tiempo libre, también sus hijos se involucran en las actividades agrícolas al salir de clases.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar hilo de seda para elaborar hamacas, también comprar fertilizantes, plaguicidas y herbicidas para apoyar a su esposo con el cultivo que va a establecer y comprara 24 pollitos de engorde para venderlos en la temporada de fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old, is married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school.  Maria completed basic education through the third grade, but due to the distance of the school from her home she had to quit her studies.  She works making hammocks.  She lives with her four children and her husband, who is a farmer. She provides for her four children.

In addition to making hammocks, she also cares for small domestic animals, raising chickens at home and also helping her husband with agricultural work when she has time.  Her children also help with the farm work after school. 

She will use her loan to purchase silk thread for making hammocks.  She will also buy fertilizer, fungicides and herbicides in order to support her husband's crop.  She will also buy 24 baby chicks to fatten and then sell during the Christmas holidays.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread for making hammocks.  She will also buy fertilizer, fungicides and herbicides in order to support her husband's crop.  She will also buy 24 baby chicks to fatten and then sell during the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Sumac Tica Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SUMAC TICA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Urubamba  en la provincia de Urubamba departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cipriana  tiene 46 años de edad, soltera y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a  la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su  familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, venta de comida, elaboración de chicha, crianza de animales, venta de cereales ganadería, tienda de abarrotes.
La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos ya que el espacio donde se juntaron era pequeño.
La socia que sale adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC TICA communal bank, which is located in the Urubamba district and province, within the Cusco department.

The member's name is Cipriana; she is 46 years old, is single, and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with a food-selling business. She sells her products from door to door to the customers who request it. She also raises small animals. She hopes to be able to keep on working so that she can continue to support her family.

Cipriana is requesting a loan to buy products such as oil and rice, among others.

She is grateful for the granted loan and is committed to making all her loan payments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

The other members make a living selling vegetables, selling food, making "chicha" [a cold drink made with maize or fruit], raising animals, selling grains, ranching, and running a grocery store.

The photo was taken in two parts because the space where the group gathered was small. The member in the small photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work-related reasons.

loans.use: to purchase products such as oil and rice, among others.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Bendición de Dios está conformada por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, todos  tienen diferentes actividades económicas, actividad que la disfruta mucho ya que es el medio de subsistencia de sus familias.
Gracias  a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Aura la cual tiene por actividad la venta de ropa nueva variada como: pantalones, shores, faldas, vestidos, blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niño, toallas, ropa de cama,  el negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante, la rutina de trabajo de Aura es salir a las calles todos los día con un bulto de unos 20 kg ofreciendo su mercadería a clientes fijos y por encargos. El objetivo del crédito es comprar nueva mercadería para surtir el negocio, y además necesita comprar una vitrina para exhibir y ofrecer la mercadería en su casa de habitación. Aura agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Bendición de Dios Communal Bank is made up of 11 members, 10 women and a man, responsible parents with 20 children in their care.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  They're known for being hardworking and responsible, and for wanting to improve themselves personally.  They all have different jobs, something they like very much because it's the way they support their families.

Aura's the coordinator, thanks to her desire to get ahead.  Her job is selling a variety of clothing: pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, blouses, underwear, children's clothing, towels, and linens.  She carries out her job as a street vendor.  Aura's work routine is to go out every day with a bundle that weighs about 20 kilograms and sell her merchandise to steady customers on order.

The purpose of the loan is to buy new merchandise to stock her business.  She also needs to buy a display case to show and sell the merchandise in her home.

Aura's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have the means to decent work.

loans.use: to buy clothing, towels, and linens

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
Asociación comunal Luz Divina está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María Inés y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es  una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jabón, detergente, aceite. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Asociación comunal Luz Divina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Luz Divina Communal Bank is made up of nine members, eight women and a man from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  They're known for being hardworking and responsible, and for their desire for personal self-improvement.  Currently they strive every day to give their children a better future.

María Inés is the coordinator, thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead.  Her job is a "pulpería," a small store that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soap, detergent, and oil.  She devotes about 12 hours a day to her business selling her products.

The loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with buying and selling food products.  That way, she'll be able to earn a better income in the near future.

Luz Divina Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to decent work.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soap, detergent, and oil

loans.name: María Eloisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  10 y 7 y 5 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es Ing. eléctrico.
Doña María prepara deliciosos almuerzos bajo pedido, entrega los almuerzos en varias instituciones de la localidad y a personas particulares.  Tiene  muchos clientes ya que cocina delicioso y les da crédito.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito, gracias a sus ganancias a podido mejorar su negocio ya que compro varias cosas que le hacían falta para dar un mejor servicio, con esto gano mas clientela lo cual es muy bueno para ella. Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, lacteos, carne y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva un año  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the group "Crédito San Cristóbal" meets in Tosagua. It is a place known for being very dynamic and where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture or raising livestock. It is an area with a lot of vegetation.

This is where Maria lives. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children who are 10, 7 and 5 years old. All of them go to school. Her husband is an electrical engineer.

Maria prepares delicious lunches and delivers them to various institutions in the area and to individuals as well. She has many customers because she is such a great cook and she also offers credit.

She is asking for another loan, and thanks to her earnings she has been able to improve her business after she bought various things she needed in order to give a better service. She was able to gain more customers, and things have been very good for her. This loan will be used to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, meat and other. She has been with the group Crédito San Cristóbal for one year and she likes it because the loans have been a big help for her.

Her dream is to see her children having professional careers.

loans.use: ice, sugar, purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, and other.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale to stock his business.

loans.name: María Ramona

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija mayor de  edad que aun vive en su casa, con ellos también vive un nieto. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña María y su familia tienen un bazar y papelería en su casa, este negocio lo tienen dese hace mas de 30 años allí venden ropa, zapatos, perfumes, tarjetas, cosas para regalos, útiles escolares y artículos necesarios para los estudiantes, allí trabaja junto a su querido esposo y que gracias a este negocio salen adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como pueden financiar su negocio y así salir adelante, sus ganancias son para los gastos que genera el hogar. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y útiles escolares. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos son rápidos y a bajo interés. Sus sueños es seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group "La Estancia" meets every two weeks in the village of Estancilla from the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raise animals, as it is an area with lots of vegetation.

This is where Maria lives. She is 67 years old, and is married. From this marriage she has an older daughter that still lives at home. Their grandson also lives at home with them. Her husband is retired.

Maria and her family have a variety store and stationary shop in their home. They have had this business for more than 30 years, and they sell clothes, shoes, perfumes, cards, gift items, school supplies, and items that students needs. She works there with her husband, and thanks to this business, they get ahead.

Maria is requesting a new loan since this is how they can finance their business and get ahead. The profits go towards the home expenses. This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams and school supplies. From the beginning, Maria has enjoyed working with this credit group because the loans are fast with low interest. Her dream is to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams and school supplies.

loans.name: Daniel Ernesto

texts.es:
Daniel de 22 años de edad, por los escasos recursos economicos que tenian sus padres él no pudo seguir estudiando, él queria prepararse pero desde pequeño sus padres le inculcaron mucho lo de trabajar para ganarse la vida por si mismo, hace dos años se acompaño con una joven pero lamentablemente no pudieron vivir bien por lo que decidieron separarse y él se quedo con la niña que tiene un año de edad, en la actualidad esta soltero solamente vive con su hija de un año.
 
Daniel se dedica a la agricultura ya lleva 10 años de dedicarse por si solo a esto, tambien se dedica en los tiempos libres por la tarde a trabajar en una construcción de ladrillo, que le queda a un paso de su casa ya que solo el muro los separa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una motocicleta, para trasportarse al lugar donde realiza sus cultivos, por la lejania del lugar, se le haria más facíl con ese medio de trasporte.

Sus aspiraciones como buen padre y joven de buenos pensamientos dice que es poder tener su negocio propio, para poder darle a su hija lo necesario en todos los ambitos y que Dios les de buena salud.
texts.en:
Daniel is 22  years old, and due to his parents' lack of financial resources he was unable to continue his studies.  He wanted to prepare himself but even when he was very young, his parents instilled in him the importance of working to earn his own living. Two years ago he began living with a young woman, but sadly, they were unable to get along and decided to separate. They had a one-year-old daughter who lives with Daniel. He is now single and lives only with  his daughter.

Daniel is a farmer and has been doing only this for 10 years. In his spare time in the afternoon he also works building a brick structure.  It is only a step away from his house and only the wall separates them. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy a motorcycle for transportation to the place where he farms. Because of its distance, the motorcycle will make it much easier for him. As a good father and a well-intentioned young man, Daniel aspires to have his own business so he can give his daughter everything she needs and asks for God to grand them good health.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation to the fields where he grows his crops.

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: José de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 19 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador y muy  emprendedor quien se gana la vida gracias a su negocio de juegos  de mesas  de billar, en donde muchas personas llegan a distraerse. José desea reparar la puerta de su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada por lo que él desea cambiarla, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una puerta de balcón, ángulo, cemento, arena, y grava para instalar una puerta de balcón en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose, 40, lives in his own residence with his 19-year-old daughter.  He is a hard-working and very enterprising man who earns a living thanks to his pool table games business to which many people come to enjoy themselves.  
Jose wants to repair the door of his house since it is deteriorated, so he wants to change it; but he lacks the necessary economic liquidity.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUNAI in order to invest in a balcony door, angle iron, cement, sand, and gravel to install a balcony door in his residence.

loans.use: to invest in a balcony door, angle iron, cement, sand, and gravel in order to install a balcony door in his residence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize his cocoa plants and maintain his land.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario San Luis lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras y con espíritu de superación, lo coordina la señora Martha de 37 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un hijo de la edad de 16 años, por quien se ha esforzado en su negocio para brindarle mejor condición de vida, se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos, sopa, baho y leña en su domicilio; el crédito lo solicita para la compra de yuca, frijoles, plátano verde, plátano maduro, repollo, flete de leña, etc. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Ericka quien tiene la edad de 40 años y comercializa trucha y ropa nueva y de segunda mano en las calles de su comunidad desde hace tres años, y Carla de 37 años de edad y quien comercializa frutas y verduras en su domicilio desde hace quince años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group San Luis consists of three entrepreneurial women with the determination to succeed. It is coordinated by Martha, who is 37 years old. 

Martha has a life partner and a 16-year-old son. She has made great efforts in her business to provide her son with better living conditions. She sells cooked beans, soup, baho [a Nicaraguan beef dish] and firewood from her home. She is requesting the loan to purchase yucca roots, beans, green plantains, sweet plantains, cabbage, the delivery of firewood, etc. 

The other members of the group are Ericka, who is 40 years old and has been selling trout and both first- and second-hand clothing in the streets of her community for the last three years, and Carla, who is 37 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables from her home for 15 years.

loans.use: to purchase food items and firewood.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José de 68 años de edad, está acompañado desde que tenía 38 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos de 36 años de edad, 32 años de edad, 28 años de edad y 26 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque no tenía las facilidades económicas y una escuela cerca para poder asistir, su pareja es ama de casa, solo ella vive y depende totalmente de él.

Es agricultor, aprendió el oficio con su padre que también era agricultor y le enseñó a sembrar maíz, frijol y maicillo. Camina cerca de 2 kilómetros desde su casa hasta el lugar de trabajo es ayudado por su esposa y trabaja 6 horas diarias.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, plaguicidas y herbicidas para cultivar 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz, frijol y hortalizas. José espera seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y disfrutar su vejes al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 68 years old, has been married since he was 38, and has four children, ages 36, 32, 28 and 26. He did not have the opportunity to study as he did not have the economic resources and a nearby school to attend. His partner is a housewife, only she lives at home and depends entirely on him. 

José is a farmer and learned the trade with his father who was also a farmer, and taught him how to plant corn, bean, and sorghum. He walks about two kilometers from his house to his workplace, is helped by his wife, and works six hours per day. 

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and herbicides in order to grow 7,000 square meters of corn, bean, and sorghum. José hopes to continue working on what he likes and enjoy his old age beside his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and herbicides to grow 7,000 square meters of corn, bean, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kelly Yessenia

texts.es:
Kelly es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, trabaja como Asistente Administrativo en su ciudad natal, Sunampe. También está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en la Universidad, ella se esfuerza cada día tanto en el trabajo como en sus clases porque quiere convertirse en una profesional exitosa para el orgullo de su familia y para que pueda sacarlos adelante.
