Kelly quiere mejorar su rendimiento en la Universidad es por ello que va a utilizar el crédito para poder comprar una laptop para continuar bien con sus estudios y hacer sus trabajos y todo lo que le piden. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que esto será de gran ayuda porque logrará terminar su carrera con honores.
texts.en:
Kelly is a young woman with a great desire to excel. She works as an administrative assistant in her home town, Sunampe. She is also studying accounting at the university. She strives every day in her work as well as in her classes because she wants to become a successful professional and be the pride of her family and move them forward. 
Kelly wants to improve her performance at her university. She is going to use the loan to purchase a laptop so she can continue doing well with her studies, her work and everything asked of her. She is very grateful to  the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that this will be a great help because she will be able to finish her degree with honors.

loans.use: purchase a laptop for her classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for formalities to get his driver's license.

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es:
Desde niño Augusto fue bueno con los  números y las cuentas, la matemática era su fuerte, siempre sobresalió como buen estudiante. Hasta que decidió convertirlo en su profesión  ahora Augusto cursa su quinto año de Contaduría Pública, labora en dicha universidad como asistente administrativo, se caracteriza por ser responsable, emprendedor. En sus tiempos libres trabaja en una empresa de rotulaciones para obtener dinero extra. Al ser padre de familia de dos hijos de 16 y 6 años quiere expandir su capital para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, comprometido con el bienestar de su familia.
Al ser una carrera que tiene un amplio campo de trabajo y de especializaciones Augusto solicita el crédito para el pago de un seminario de gerencia de recursos humanos, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para poder obtener un ascenso en su puesto de trabajo para generar más ingresos en su familia y de esta manera mejorar la estabilidad económica. Al mismo tiempo agradece el apoyo de sus familiares que cada día lo motivan para que logre culminar sus estudios y como metas a futuro tomar otros cursos que le ayuden a afianzar sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Since was a child, Augusto was good with numbers and accounts.  Mathematics was his strength.  He always stood out as a good student.  Since then, he decided to make it his profession and now Augusto is in his fifth year of public accounting studies.  He works in the university as an administrative assistant.  He is characterized as being responsible and enterprising.  In his free time, he works in a label company to make extra money.  Since he is the father of two children, 16 and 6, he wants to expand his capital in order to improve the quality of life of his family.  He is committed to the well-being of his family.
Since it is a career with lots of work and specializations, Augusto requests the loan for the payment for a seminar in human resource management.  He puts his confidence in the financing in order to be able to get a promotion in his job in order to generate more income for the family and in this way improve the economic stability.  At the same time, he is grateful for the support of his family members who motivate him every day to finish his studies and for his future goals to take other courses the will help strengthen his knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for a seminar in human resource management.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca has been in this business for 25 years now.

Rebecca requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
In the year 2011, Nenita made a banana plantation in Pagadian. She went to Paglaum MPC for the financial assistance it offers and, as a farmer, she borrowed a loan to start her banana production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. 

To this day, Nenita feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season.

Nenita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana production.

loans.name: Noris Del Carmen

texts.es: Noris de 23 años de edad es soltera y vive con su padre y un sobrino en su vivienda que es propia desde hace 22 años. Ella es una joven trabajadora que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de minutas y productos por catalogo los que vende de forma ambulante. Noris ha observado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, ya que la madera se ha picado y las laminas del techo se encuentran corroídas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, clavos, cemento y mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda. expresa estar muy agradecida con el apoyo que recibió para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Noris is 23 years old, single, and lives with her father and nephew in their house that they have owned for 22 years. She is a young, hardworking woman that has made a living selling minutas (shaved ice snacks) and catalog products for the past two years by selling in different neighborhoods. Noris has noticed that the roof of her house has deteriorated, as the wood is full of holes, and the roof sheet is corroded. As a result, she is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: sheet, nails, cement, and labor in order to change the roof of her house. She expresses great gratitude from the support received in order to invest in her business.

loans.use: to by: sheet, nails, cement, and pay for labor in order to change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia. Group

texts.es: Gelacia de 66 años de edad es casada. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está conformado por 06 socias responsables y solidarias. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y edredones. Viene desempeñándose hace más de 02 años ambulatoriamente. Su mayor deseo es contar con un puesto de venta para poder exhibir sus productos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de polos, camisas, pantalones y shorts. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Gelacia se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
The "Sagrada Familia" Group is made up of six responsible and supportive members.

Gelacia is 66 years old and is married. She makes a living selling articles of clothing and quilts. She has been a peddler for over two years now, and her greatest wish is to have a stall at which she can showcase her products. 

She will use her latest loan to buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, and shorts. 

The "Sagrada Familia" Group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support. 

In the photo, Gelacia is seated first from the left and wearing a light blue T-shirt.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, and shorts for her business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in his nearby town. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work for daily wages. He also brings some material home for Samina, because she helps him in the completion of embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance. For this purpose, he requires some capital to buy desired inventories, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Samina made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours. 

Samina is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours for her husband's business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline who is 35 and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bartolome, a driver and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Evangeline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Evangeline is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Evangeline wants her business to continue to flourish, and she hopes for good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman and has been blessed with kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mercy operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for sometime now. She mentioned disease outbreaks, that cause losses, as a challenge in her business. Mercy dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 Mercy wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy additional merchandise like chips, biscuits, beverages, toiletries, rice,  and canned goods

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 36 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Emma has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en:
Shohista lives in a rural area. She was born in the year 1978 to the family of a farmer. Her parents grew agriculture products. 

She is married and brings up three children. Her husband’s income is small and it is not enough to provide the family with all necessary things. Shohista is going to organize own business deal and find a source of income. 

She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a woman's organization and got a certificate. Shohista is going to start a business with animal husbandry. As she lives in a rural area she has a good opportunity to develop an animal husbandry business. 

Shohista is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 46 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jesusa has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, noodles, chocolate drinks, soft-drinks, candies, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son makes iron chains by hand in his workshop. The chain is made on a hearth by hammering cut lengths of red-hot wrought iron rod into oval links, one link passing through the next to form a cable.

A few days ago the iron rod coil was stolen from his workshop, so now he is unable to make any chains to sell and cannot get income as well.

Jamila has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy a new iron rod coil and start his business again.

Jamila is the mother of three sons and it is very difficult to feed all of them in a day. Her dreams are to provide all the necessities to her each child. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: to buy a new iron rod coil for making chains by hand.

loans.name: Erimia

texts.en:
Erimia is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas and sweet potatoes to sell. He faces the challenge of weather changes. Besides that, he hopes to build a permanent house. 

Erimia needs a loan to complete payment for land.

loans.use: to complete payment for land.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 44-year-old married woman, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband provides services for troubleshooting refrigerators, air conditioners, and dispensers. Regarding his business, from time to time he has to buy refrigeration accessories such as compressors, condensers, relays, overloads, etc., to continue his business. He buys all the accessories to offer his customers a good price. Mostly customers do not have awareness about the rates which are beneficial for getting more profit. 

She requested a loan so that her husband could buy all accessories such as compressors, condensers, relays, overloads, etc., so that he can get maximum turnover.

Alia wishes for the bright future of her for her family and her dream to provide better education to her coming children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools, gas cylinders, and copper pipes for a refrigeration workshop.

loans.name: Bunena Tukwatanise 'a' Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a fifty-six-year-old, hard-working married man with nine children living in Kamwenge Uganda. 

He deals in farming where he grows coffee and cassava, alongside teaching where he earns additional income. He ventured into these businesses on realizing that there is an available market for quick sales. 

His main challenge is the high rate of taxation and price fluctuations of agricultural products, though he hopes to increase on his profits and have educated children. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a businesswoman from Pagadian City. She is 52 years old, widowed, and has expertise in selling. 

She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Rosita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. 

Now she is applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rosita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for her sari-sari such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Srujana

texts.en:
Srujana is 22 years old, a young girl. She lives in the capital city of Odisha called Bhubaneswar with her parents and siblings. 

She graduated from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, in 2014. Now she is pursuing a post-graduate diploma in banking and finance from a reputed institute of Bhubaneswar called Times Pro with a guaranteed job in private sector banks.

Srujana has requested a loan of 72,000 INR to pay her banking and finance course fee. You can make it possible for her to continue with her course and get placed in one of the leading private banks of the country.

loans.use: to pay her banking and finance course fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a set of furniture for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap [for resale].

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 51 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela aunque él queria aprender a leer no pudo, ya que sus padres en ese tiempo no le exijian ya que la escuela estaba lejos de la casa y antes no habian muchas escuelas, en ese tiempo la escuela mas cercana estaba a 2 dos horas de su casa caminando.

Juan esta acompañado y padre de 7 hijos de las edades 20, 26, 23, 20, 18, 15, 10. Cinco de esos hijos viven aun con ellos, los demas estan acompañados aparte, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domesticos, a la cria de aves de corrales, gallinas, jolotes, patos y cerdos.

Juan posee una larga experiencia de trabajar en la agricultura, son unos 42 años de dedicarse a esto, que lo aprendio de su padre, ya que no tenia otra oportunidad de como obtener ingresos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, sulfato y pago de mano de obra, para su cultivo de maíz. Con ello se facilitara en el negocio y obtener una mejor cosecha. Sus aspiraciones son tener mejores recursos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old and did not have the chance to go to school. Although he would have liked to learn to read, he was not able to, as his parents at that time did not require him to go, since the school was far from the house and in those days there weren't many schools. At that time the nearest school was a two-hour walk from his home.  

Juan is married, and the father of seven children, ages 26, 23, 20, 20,18,15 and 10. Five of these children live with them;  the others are married and live on their own. His life partner is a housewife, and raises farmyard animals such as chickens, turkeys, ducks and pigs.

Juan has a long experience working in agriculture, and has been doing this work, which he learned from his father, for 42 years, as he had no other way of earning income.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizers, sulfate and pay for labor, so that he can grow corn. With this, his business will do better, and he will obtain a  better harvest. His ambition is to have more income, so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, sulfate, and pay for labor for growing corn.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto de 26 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo. Por motivo de escasos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° de educación básica, dejo la escuela y se dedicó a trabajar como agricultor. Además de su hijo, vive con su mamá, ambos dependen de él.

Edilberto tiene un negocio en su casa, presta servicio de molienda, viajó al extranjero 3 años y luego de trabajar regreso para cuidar a su madre que es de edad avanzada, compro dos molinos y los instalo en su casa, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm y cuando él no puede le ayuda un tío.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar un repuesto para el molino, tiene los discos gastados y necesita reemplazarlos para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a los clientes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 26 years old, single and has one child. Because of lack of income, he was only able to attend school until the sixth grade. He left school and began work as a farmer. In addition to his son, he lives with his mother, and both depend on him. 

Edilberto has a business in his home– a milling service.  He traveled outside the country for three years, and after working there, came back to look after his mother, who is elderly. He bought two mills and set them up in his home. He works every day from 6 AM until 5 PM and and when he can't, his uncle helps him.

The loan will be used to buy a part for his mill. The mill has worn out discs and he needs to replace them in order to continue offering a good service to the customers in his community.

loans.use: To buy a part for his mill.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход молодой парень в возрасте 26 лет. Он живет в сельской местности и занимается животноводством. Фарход с детства ухаживает за скотом. Эта любовь к животным передалось ему от отца, который тоже занимался животноводством. В молодости отец подарил ему пару ягнят и он сам их вырастил и откормил. Когда они выросли он продал их и купил несколько ягнят и т.д. таким образом Фарход стал заниматься животноводством чем и занимается до сих пор. На данный момент он испытывает финансовую нужду и решил обратиться за помощью в «Арванд» чтоб до сезона не продавать свой скот за более низкую цену.
texts.en: Farhod is 26 years old. He lives in the countryside as a farmer. Since childhood he has taken care of livestock and has inherited his father's love for animals. In Farhod's youth his father, also a farmer, gifted his son with two lambs and Farhod reared them himself. When the sheep were fully grown he sold them and bought more lambs, which was the start of his business. As Farhod is currently in need of money, he has turned to "Arvand" for help. This will allow him to avoid underselling his livestock before the seasonal rise in prices.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rahimqul

texts.ru: Рахимкул - с малых лет помогал отцу и занимался земледелием и животноводством. Сейчас ему 39 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Основной доход семьи он получает от земледелия. Рахимкул обратился в МДО Арванд,  чтобы  поддержали его в финансовом затруднении,так как  он хочет купить скот чтобы откармливать и продавать их на местном рынке. Занимаясь этой деятельностью он принесет дополнительный доход в семью. Он выражает благодарность за такую возможность и доверие. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и надеется на помощь.
texts.en: Since his childhood Rahimqul helped his father grows crops and take care of livestock. Now he is 39 years old, married and a father of three children. He still supports his family by farming. Rahimqul has turned to "Arvand" for financial support so that he can finance a purchase of new calves for fattening and resale. Expanding his herd will bring additional income to the family. Rahimqul is grateful to this opportunity and trust. He wants to thank everyone for the support and hopes you will be able to help him.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Vuong's Group

texts.en:
Vuong, born in 1965, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in the Mai Son district, Son La province. Her children are intelligent and docile, and her oldest daughter has graduated from college and has a job. Her youngest son passed the entrance examination for the vocational college this year.

Her main job is livestock breeding and cultivation. She has to save money to cover her children’s education costs despite the low income of her job. She now wants to borrow a loan to pay for her son’s education costs for the first year of studying at the college.

She hopes her son will have good results in his studies and have a stable job after graduation from college in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education costs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 72-year-old farmer located in the Lari location in Thika, Kenya. He has a 52-year-old wife and six children who are all grownups. Moses has been doing mixed farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea.

Moses is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter that will make his work easier when processing animal feed. Chopping grass into pieces using basic tools like a machete can be tiring, especially for a septuagenarian.

By lending $25, you will have brought untold relief and efficiency to Moses' farm. He will be able to chaff hay that would last the cow for weeks all at once. A chaff cutting machine also produces a much better quality of work than human hands because the hay is cut into ideal and almost identical sizes. This makes the cows enjoy their meal and in turn thank Moses by producing more milk. This symbiotic relationship will work well even for you as the lender because Moses will make enough money selling milk to repay your loan.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Fe Aurea

texts.en:
Fe Aurea is 63 years old and has nine children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Fe Aurea is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe Aurea has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fe Aurea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeofrey

texts.en: Jeofrey used the previous loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation. He is a farmer who mainly deals in banana growing for both commercial and home consumption plus a retail shop for additional income. He still faces the same challenges of weather changes and the banana bacterial wilt. He has a vision of buying land to increase his banana productivity. Jeofrey needs a loan to pay for labour and plant more bananas.

loans.use: to pay for labour and plant more bananas.

loans.name: Oybahor

texts.ru: Ойбахор трудолюбивая, добрая и верующая женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она живет вместе сестрами и братьями на районе Шахритус. Ойбахор кредитуется у нас второй раз. http://www.kiva.org/lend/473502. Первый кредит она брала 2 года назад на сумму $1000. Первый кредит стал большой помощью. Ойбахор надеется с таким уже успехом получить финансирования еще раз. Ойбахор на заемные деньги увеличит поголовья скотин, что поможет ей увеличить доход, чтобы вложить больше средств для образования детей. Ойбахор заранее благодарит Вас!
texts.en: Oybahor is a hardworking, kind and religious woman. She is 40 years old. She lives with her sisters and brothers in the Shahrituz region. This is her second loan. She took out a two year, 1000 dollar loan in the past and it was a huge help for her. Oybahor hopes that this loan will be equally successfully funded. She will use the money to expand her herd of cattle, which will increase her profits and allow her to save for her children's education. Oybahor wants to thank everyone in advance!

loans.use: to expand the herd

loans.name: Johaden

texts.en:
Johaden is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also does farming, which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru: Косим - сотрудничает с МДО Арванд с сентября 2013 года.  По профессии он учитель.Заработная плата учителя не хватает на расходы и содержание семьи. Так как он с детства любит животных, он начал заниматься животноводством.  На первый кредит он купил  два барана, в течении 6 месяцев откармливал их и продал на местном рынке за более высокую цену.   У него есть сын Мамалатиф. Он студент первого курса.  Косим узнал от сотрудников Арванд о том, что есть кредит для оплаты учёбы.  Он хочет взять кредит для оплаты учебы сына. Он подал заявку на кредит и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Kosim has been collaborating with "Arvand" since 2013. He is a teacher, and his monthly salary is insufficient to provide for his family. As he always liked animals, Kosim started supplementing his salary by raising livestock. He used his first loan to purchase two sheep and was able to sell the animals at the local market for a profitable price after 6 month of care. Kosim has a son, Mamalatif. He is a freshman in college. Kosim found out from Arvand about loans to finance tuition. He wants to take out such a loan to pay for his son's college tuition. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education

loans.name: Hukmon

texts.en:
Hukmon, 49, is an ambitious, hardworking smallholder mixed-farmer based in a rural area in Tajikistan. The climate here greatly favours high-altitude cash crops and dairy farming, which he is involved in. He also keeps cows for milk and grows vegetables to sell. The income he makes from farming is not sufficient to sustain his family of two children, two daughters-in-law and three grandchildren.

Hukmon has five ha (hectares) of land where he works every day from early morning till late evening. He sows crops and vegetables twice a year. He must buy mineral fertilizers for his land to prepare the land for the new sowing season. With this aim he is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers.

Hukmon said that this loan would increase food security in his household.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Fatkhullo

texts.ru: Фатхулло - мужчина 35 лет ,женат ,отец троих детей. Он живёт в сельской местности.У Фатхулло большая семья и чтобы прокормить её , ему приходиться работать на трёх работах одновременно. Он рабочий на стройке ,занимающейся строительством и ремонтом домов и зданий. Эта работа требует большого физического труда.Также Фатхулло работает в парикмахерской и водителем маршрутки. Фатхулло очень устаёт и к этому еще берёт сверхурочные часы. Он работает в поте лица,потому что хочет ,чтобы его семья и дети жили не зная нужд. Также Фатхулло копит деньги на образование детей,так как хочет дать своим детям хорошее высшее образование. Он планирует отремонтировать дом,но на данный момент не имеет нужной суммы. Поэтому Фатхулло обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Фатхулло заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Fatkhullo is a 35 year old husband and father of three children. He lives in a village, so to feed his large family Fatkhullo works three different jobs. He is a construction worker who builds and repairs private houses and larger buildings. This work requires a great deal of physical labor. Fatkhullo also works in a barber shop and as a taxi driver. He is frequently tired, but still works overtime whenever he can. All of this he does for the sake of his family, for Fatkhullo wants his children to grow up in comfort. He also is saving money for tuition, as he wants to give his kids a good college education. He also needs to repair his home, but lacks money for this. That is why Fatkhullo has turned to "Arvand" for a loan. He wants to thank Arvand for their trust and support in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his meat stock and buy an advanced meat cutter.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mirasol works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Mirasol is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like lotion, lipsticks, bath soap, shoes, bags, etc. to sell..

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like lotion, lipsticks, bath soap, shoes, and bags to sell

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana, age 32, is the mother of a son living with her kid and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is taking a loan for her husband’s business. He sells and purchases vehicle tires.  He is a religious and energetic person and through this business, he generates income for his family. He wants to buy more vehicle tires to grow his business but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to do so. 

Therefore, Shabana has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request to take a loan. Shabana seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires for her husband's enterprise.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 35, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior; he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income and providing their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Regina would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 25,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She will also use a portion of the loan to pay for the maintenance of their tricycle. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Regina wants to buy another unit of tricycle, which they can also use for transportation services. She also desires to have some home renovation. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Flora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Flora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Norma Cristina

texts.es:
Norma de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica,  es soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 18 años de edad que está estudiando bachillerato y depende completamente de ella.

Norma es comerciante, administra una tienda desde hace 15 años, en ocasiones la apoya su hijo, la tienda en la única forma con que norma a sacado adelante a su hijo, no se dedica a otra actividad económica.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar jabón, azúcar, aceite, maíz, frijoles, arroz y demás artículos de primera necesidad y canasta básica para abastecer el inventario de la tienda y tener suficiente producto para ofrecer a sus clientes. Norma espera su negocio se fortalezca porque quiere que su hijo se prepara académicamente y tenga las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old and studied until the sixth year of elementary school. She is single and has an 18-year-old son, who is studying for his high school diploma, and entirely depends on her. 

Norma is a businesswoman, managing a store for 15 years, occasionally with the help of her son. The store is the only way that Norma has supported her son, and she does not earn a living by any other financial means. 

The loan will be used to buy ham, sugar, oil, corn, beans, rice, and other necessities and staple goods, to supply the store inventory and have a sufficient amount of products to offer her customers. Norma hopes her business strengthens because she wants her son to be academically prepared, and have opportunities that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy ham, sugar, oil, corn, beans, rice, and other necessities and staple goods

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 36, is a housewife. She is the mother of two children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a carpet sale shop. This business is the only source of income for the family. Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan to purchase more carpet stock for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Nasreen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more carpet stock for her husband's business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 52-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm for the next season. He deals in farming as his main source of income, although he also earns an extra income from his monthly salary. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He faces the challenges of seasonal changes and price fluctuations. He has a vision of becoming a model farmer in his area.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.en:
Jurabek is a 32-year-old married man. He has three children. His family is large as there are seven members. His parents live with him. Jurabek is a farmer. He has been busy growing potatoes and wheat on six hectares of land for more than 15 years. He has a great experience in farming. His wife and parents help him to grow potatoes and wheat. He sows potatoes and wheat twice a year.

Farming is much expanded in Tajikistan and raising potatoes and wheat is in high demand. People raise wheat and sell the harvest to bakeries, restaurants, or local bazaars. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy seeds of wheat and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Due to inadequate income, Paula operates a motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. She is 52 years old and blessed with nine children. She aims to earn a higher income to sustain the family's daily needs and finance the education of her children. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. Having this financial assistance, Paula believes that she will continuously operate her motorcycle and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tomato garden to obtain tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Imperial junto a su familia. Se dedica a atrabajar como obrero de campo. Al terminar el colegio tuvo que empezar a atrabajar debido a la baja economía en su familia, por ello él utiliza esto como una motivación para luchar cada dáa para lograr sus sueños.
Carlos tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que va a utilizar el crédito para poder comprarse un ropero para poder guardar su ropa y tener su cuarto más ordenado. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto seguirá luchando para más adelante poder empezar a estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man who has a strong will to get ahead.  He is single and lives in Imperial with his family.  He makes a living working in the fields.  He had to start working after finishing school because of the economic situation of his family.  He uses this as motivation to fight every day to achieve his dreams.

Carlos really wants to improve the quality of his life, and therefore he will use this loan to buy a wardrobe to keep his clothes in and keep his room more organized.  He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity.  He wants them to know that the loan will help him to keep fighting to be able to start studying to become a professional later on.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe to keep his clothes in

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Anafe is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Anafe has been raising cattle for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Erimina

texts.en:
Erimina is a single mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. In the photo, Erimina carries one of her children on her back

Erimina has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Erimina dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct an annex and buy construction materials

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a farmer based in Kaboi village situated up north in Kenya. He is married to a lovely lady called Nancy and the couple has two baby boys. This family has made ends meet through mixed farming for six years.  Julius, the head, makes the primary income from selling milk, eggs and tea from the farm. He is also entangled in cereal trading to make an extra shilling.
  
Julius want more out of his farm. He is determined to scale every corner of his business. To achieve this, however, he needs something that he doesn't have: capital. Julius turned to a small group of farmers in the village comprised of and mostly led by mothers. The women in this group seemed to have a source of money and a yearning for progress that he could not fathom. As it turned out, they were part of Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's Field Partner in Kenya. 

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase poultry, fertilizer and cereals: The acquired poultry will expand Julius' asset base and his farm's egg production; the cereals will build up the stock of his cereal brokerage and the fertilizer will prepare a fertile seedbed for planting more tea. 

Julius stated, "I will grow agriculture enterprises to elevate the quality of life being led by my family."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, poultry and cereals

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 50 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Basilisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, juice, milk, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Basilisa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, juice, milk, shampoo, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, juice, milk, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic plates, cups and containers, and groceries in order to stock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her work equipment and buy new equipment

loans.name: Santos Gregorio

texts.es:
En la vida hay que ser atrevidos las cosas no vienen por si sola sino uno mismo tiene que levantarse e ir por ellas es la decisión de Santos de 62 años de edad, el a pesar de su avanzada edad a tomado la decisión de emprender actividades que le generen un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia, el tiene 4 hijos y 3 hijas todos ellos residentes en Sololá.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza bajo un sol agotador es de jornalero en la comunidad donde el vive, el es buscado por las personas de su comunidad para que el les realiza diferentes tipos de actividades para poder el tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de su familia, el viene realizando dicha actividad desde que tenía 17 años de edad y hoy hasta la fecha lo está realizando.

El uso que el dará al crédito es para cambiar las laminas del techo de su casa porque ya lleva 20 años de uso y con el tiempo y el cambio climático la ha perjudicado y es por ello que el quiere realizar un cambio para que su familia vivan en condiciones adecuadas y no tener que sufrir en tiempos de lluvias.

Uno de las aspiraciones de Santos es que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida y conseguir terreno para que el también empiece a producir productos agrícolas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
In life, you have to be bold.  Things don't just come on their own, you have to stand up and reach for them yourself.

Santos, 62, decided this was true despite his advanced age and made the decision to work to generate income for the benefit of his family.  He has 4 sons and 3 daughters who are all residents of Sololá.

He works with dignity under the tiring sun as a day laborer in the community where he lives.  People in his community seek him out to do various kinds of work, which allows him to bring in income to support his family.  He has been doing this work since he was 17 years old and he is still doing it today.  

The purpose of the loan is to change the tiles on the roof of his house that have been used for 20 years and have been damaged by the passage of time and the changing climate.  Therefore, he wants to change them so that his family can live in adequate conditions and not have to suffer during the rainy season.  

One of Santos' aspirations is that his children become professionals in various fields and acquire land so that they can also start to produce agricultural products in their communities.

loans.use: to change the tiles on his roof

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un joven muy trabajador, soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Actualmente trabaja brindando servicio de transporte en una mototaxi alrededor de la ciudad, también como tiene muchos deseos de superación está estudiando una profesión en la Universidad, es muy trabajador y estudioso, él cree que le está yendo todo bien por su constante dedicación y sobre todo porque ha recibido un buen ejemplo de sus padres.
Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un electrodoméstico como una refrigeradora para su vivienda, así sus comidas se conservarán mejor por más tiempo. Más adelante espera culminar su carrera y convertirse en un gran profesional y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hard-working young man.  He is single and lives with his family.  Presently, he makes a living providing transportation services around the city in a motocab.  He also has aspirations to improve himself, so he is studying to be a professional at the University.  He is very hard-working and studious.  He believes that everything is going well for him because of his constant dedication and above all because he received a good job from his parents.

Jose is grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity.  With their support, he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his home, and therefore his food will last longer.  In the future, he hopes to finish his degree and become a great professional to help his family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for better food preservation

loans.name: Mukumjon

texts.en:
Mukumjon successfully repaid his previous loan and he used it as intended. He is very grateful to everyone who has helped him with the financing. Today, Mukumjon's business consists of two dairy cows and five sheep. He also grows crops. Mukumjon’s wife helps him to feed cattle and grow crops. The main family income is from farming. So, it is not enough to improve their living conditions and that’s why they live poorly. 

Mukumjon is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS to buy two cows in order to increase his livestock headcount and milk volume. Mukumjon plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing his livestock headcount and he also wants to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy two cows to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora owns and operates a food stall. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her mobile phone loading service.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 12,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings in larger quantities. She is hoping for your positive response to this.

Flora wants to save money for the future of her family. She also desires to have expand her business expansion. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 60 year old, hardworking, man with 9 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. 

John is a retailer and at the same time a farmer. He faces the challenge of bad debtors. Besides that, he has hopes of paying school fees for his children and having a healthy family.

John is requesting a loan to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, soap, salt and omo to sell.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, soap, salt, and omo to sell

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
An older woman from Pursat province, Khan, 51, is a mother of six children, one of whom is in university. She can earn income to improve her living conditions via rice cropping. Moreover, she trades rice to earn additional income. 

This is not first time for Khan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to pay school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in university. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 42-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for construction. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. This is so that he can generate more income for financially support of his family. Asia is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 40-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows coffee and bananas. He faces the challenges of limited capital, seasonal changes and income. However, he hopes to educate his children to higher levels of learning and diversify his agriculture to include cattle rearing. Hussein needs a loan to buy a heifer to rear.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to rear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 lengths of "pagne" (colorful African cloth) and 30 lengths of bazin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 cases of soft drinks and 20 cases of fruit juices

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi lives in Dalarik village in the Armavir region with her big and nice family: her parents-in-laws, husband and two daughters. 

Armenuhi and her husband work at the local village bakery. She bakes and her husband distributes the bread. Besides their work at the bakery, the family farm also brings a profit to this family. On the farm, Armenuhi keeps pigs and cultivates tomatoes, eggplant, and peppers. To be able to invest in the farm and cover some urgent costs, Armenuhi has requested this loan. She plans to use it to repair the truck, which helps her husband to transport the gathered harvest to market and sell it there. The loan will be also used for covering harvest gathering costs to pay for hired workers. 

Armenuhi received a prior loan from a local financial institution but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. Thanks to her hard work in recent times, Armenuhi has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: repair her truck and pay for hired workers for the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: vato buy more riety of fresh fish and maintenance for the motorcycle like fuel, and tire

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johbosco lives in the town of Masindi Uganda. He operates a retail business dealing in general merchandise. He bought a motor vehicle to supplement his income. He started the business to make ends meet by supporting his family. He hopes to build a residential house in spite of inadequate capital, competition and bad roads.

Johbosco will use the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, glue, soles, and more, to stock his workshop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with a child. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lucy operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and people who pass by. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Loa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loa was born in 1986 and is Thai. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income comes from agricultural crops and livestock breeding. The annual income is just enough for food and covering her family’s living expenses. She realized that the family was spending too much on labor and that this put a strain on profits throughout the year. Now she wants to buy a buffalo for plowing. This will liberate her and her husband from doing the labor and hopefully also improve profits. She hopes M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (M7-MFI) will support her and her husband in borrowing this loan.

This loan will allow her to buy a healthy buffalo to reduce hardship and increase labor productivity. This will allow her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for plowing

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray I Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY I”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Joysi ella es soltera y tiene 29 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “WAYNA TAUCARAY I” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.  

This member is Joysi. She is single and 29 years old. She works at her business, a grocery store. She also sells trout. She sells staple products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 1 year and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand the grocery business. She is asking for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice. 
 
The other members work at a restaurant, selling clothes, selling groceries and selling animals.  

She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Ana sigue  dedicándose a  su negocio de restaurante pollería, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, pollos, entre otros.
Ana está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Ana continues to work is her chicken restaurant business. She has had this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to keep working in this way to continue supporting her family. 

She is asking for the loan to buy oil, potatoes, chicken and more.

Ana is very grateful for the help from the investors for helping to fortify her economic activity which will allow her to offer her children a better education. She belongs to the “El Templo del Inca” communal bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, chicken and more.

loans.name: Noé Benjamin

texts.es:
Noé de 22 años de edad, en educación estudio hasta septimo grado. Esta soltero vive con sus padres.

Noé se dedica a la agricultura, dice que muy bien recuerda que en tres años aprendio hacerlo independiente su propia siembra,  su padre le enseño este trabajo que con gran esfuerzo él lo a ido aprendiendo, y que cada dia va mejorando; el lugar donde siembra le queda a un kilometro de distancia y se traslada caminando, en horario de 6.00 am a 11.30 am, por la tarde cuando puede va a buscar leña para vender.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una ternera para engordala y que mas adelante le de produccion. Desea mejorar su calidad de vida es uno de sus propositos y seguir adelante ayudandole a sus padres que con sacrificio lo sacaron adelante a él.
texts.en:
Noé is 22 years old and went to school up to the seventh grade. He is single and lives with his parents. Noé is a farmer, and remembers clearly learning to farm and plant his own crop independently three years ago.  His father taught him this business and he has continued learning and improving each day through great effort. 

The place where Noé farms is one kilometer away, and he walks to-and-from every day. He works there from 6 a.m. until 11:30 a.m. every day. In the afternoon, when he has time, he collects firewood to sell. 

The loan Noé requests will be used to purchase a calf for fattening and production. One of his goals is that he hopes to improve his quality of life; he also wants to get ahead and help his parents, who sacrificed so much to help him get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Emprendedoras” y está conformada por 11 mujeres optimistas y trabajadoras. Alida de 36 años de edad  separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Hace más de 02 años que viene desempeñándose ambulatoriamente donde le va bien. Su mayor deseo es contar con un local propio, para así ofrecer prendas por temporadas de frio y verano. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, licras, pantalonetas y blusas. El grupo “Las Emprendedoras” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible éste crédito. Alida se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Emprendedoras" (the entrepreneurs) group, which is composed of 11 optimistic and hard-working women. 

Alida (pictured standing in the back row, the second on the right wearing a black shirt) is 36 years old, has two dependent children, and is separated from her partner. She sells clothing items. For over two years she has been making her sales by foot, and business is going well. Her greatest wish is to have a store of her own and to offer styles for all seasons.

She requested this loan to purchase t-shirts, exercise pants, shorts and blouses. 

The whole Las Emprendedoras group is grateful to the Kiva investors who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, exercise pants, shorts and blouses.

loans.name: Ana Lucrecia

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 36 años de edad residente en Sololá, casada con cuatro hijas y dos hijos ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económico de su familia para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida.

El actividad que realiza Ana es la fabricación de artesanías con mostacitas y luego los pone a la venta en la comunidad donde ella vive ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de refacciones, ella siempre trata la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que se merecen y que algún día llegan a ser profesionales en la vida.

El uso respectivo que Ana le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mostacitas e hilos para la elaboración de artesanías  para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a sus hijos en la escuela y llegar a ser profesionales en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
She is an enterprising woman, 36 years old, resident of Sololá, married with four daughters and two sons, and she has to make an enormous effort to be able to support her family and see the way to improve the family's economic system to be able to improve their living conditions. 

The work that Ana does is making crafts with beads and later selling them in the community where she lives because for her it is an important source of income for her family, to be able to improve the living conditions they currently experience in their community. She has a second job which is selling replacement parts. She always tries to find a way to have an extra income to be able to provide her children with the education they deserve and so that some day they will become professionals in their lives. 

The use that Ana will give to the loan that she is getting is to purchase beads and string to make the crafts, to later sell them in her community and to her neighbors to have more income for herself and her family. 

One of her future goals is to purchase a retail space in the community so she can sell her merchandise and see her children grow in school and become professionals in their lives and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beads and string.

loans.name: Claudio Antonio

texts.es:
Mientras sus padres pescaban Claudio dibujaba los atardeceres, paisajes y hasta retratos de personas, su mayor deseo fue mejorar sus habilidades con el lápiz y el papel. Y hasta ahora está en proceso de realizarlo estudia Diseño gráfico y ha logrado mantener su rendimiento académico desde la escuela y ahora en la universidad. Claudio de 19 años es un joven aplicado, responsable, y con mucho ánimo para poder culminar sus estudios con éxito y poder ser un pilar fundamental en su familia de esa manera ayudar a sus padres en las cuentas de la casa.
Claudio solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora ya que es una herramienta indispensable en su carrera, para poder cumplir con sus trabajos de la universidad, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para tener una mayor accesibilidad en sus estudios y de esta manera poder culminar sus estudios con éxito y ser un profesional de calidad, Claudio cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes siempre lo motivan a continuar sus estudios y prepararse para un futuro mejor en su familia.
texts.en:
While his parents fished, Claudio drew the evenings, the landscape, and even portraits of people. His greatest desire was to improve his skills with pencil and paper. And up to now, he is in the process of doing it. He studies graphic design and has managed to maintain his academic skills from school and now is in university. Claudio is 19 years old, is a diligent, responsible young man with a lot of motivation to be able to finish his studies with success and to be a fundamental pillar of his family, in this way to help his parents with the household bills. 

Claudio asks for a loan to purchase a computer since it is an indispensable tool in his major, to be able to complete his university school work. He puts his confidence in the loan to have better accessibility for his studies and in this way be able to finish is coursework with success and be a quality professional. Claudio has his parents' support who always motivate him to continue his schooling and prepare himself for a better future in his family.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. adelaida ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de cabina de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the QORICCOYLLOR communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is Adelaida. She is single, 32 years old, and has 1 child. She works selling vegetables. She also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She has a stall in the market where she sells the vegetables. She works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. The loan is to purchase onions, carrots and cucumbers.

The member who is attached to the group photo was photographed after the meeting because she asked for permission due to work. 

The other members work in a restaurant business, an internet kiosk business, a grocery store business, and a business selling animals. 

The member is grateful to those who form a part of this dream through this platform and commits to making the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase onions, carrots and cucumbers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 52, a widow in Pagadian City, she runs a store that primarily supports for her family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. Mercy is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She has religiously paid her obligations without default. Now, she is borrowing another loan to buy 2 boxes of sardines, 2 boxes of beef loaf and corned beef, 5 dozen boxes of noodles and other basic commodities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods, dozens of noodles and other basic commodities to support her family.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
BENDIYA  est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de BAMANANKING. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la première  personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING, qui est l’un des quartiers de OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la commune rurale dudit lieu  Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grain de néré.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU, qui la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de grain de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de grain de néré. Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à BAMAKO par sac de 100kg, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bendiya is a group belonging to the Danaya of Bamananking association and comprises women who got to know each other as relatives and neighbors. They average 51 years of age and are married with an average of four children each. They run different businesses, for instance Kadiatou, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, sells néré seeds. They all live in large traditional families in Bamananking, which is a district of Ouelessebougou in the rural commune of the same name, in the Kati prefecture (in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).

They have had their small businesses for several years and their néré seeds trading business is in great demand. The members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program three years ago, with a view to satisfying their growing customer demand. They are on their fifth group loan.

Kadiatou, who is the president of the group and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the selling of néré seeds and is planning to use her loan to buy a large quantity of néré seeds. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Ouelessebougou and sells her seeds (in 100kg sacks) in Bamako, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit to a diverse customer base. She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 30,000FCFA which will enable her to repay her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy néré seeds.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 42,000 PHP loan for her to buy an additional stock of mineral water needed for her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Aside from her water distribution business, Josefina also operates a "Piso-Net" machine and offers mobile phone loading services.

Josefina wants for her business to grow and expand.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy gallons of mineral water

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey, 46, is a hardworking man who is responsible for looking after 4 children, 3 of whom attend school.He does farming, whereby he grows maize and beans to sell and use for himself. He desires to educate his children even though he complains of weather changes and pesticides that affect his crops. He needs a loan to buy chemicals and pesticides to prepare his garden.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and pesticides to prepare his garden.

loans.name: Buhara United Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Buhara United Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan. He is an active farmer, age 35 years, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He hopes to become a leading banana farmer in his village, despite the challenge of the affects of weather changes. 

Joseph needs a loan to improve his banana plantation and pay workers.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation and pay workers

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita junto a su hija, yerno  y nieta. María se gana la vida por medio de la venta de deliciosas pupusas (comida típica preparada a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.) en el mercado central de su localidad. Gracias a su carisma y buen servicio, María, cuenta con muchos clientes quienes todos los días buscan sus productos. María desea invertir en su negocio de pupusas dado que ha visto que la demanda ha aumentado y desea aprovechar la oportunidad y así poder abarcar un  mayor segmento de mercado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de maíz, arroz, frijoles, tomates, sal, queso, repollo y de más productos para la elaboración  de las deliciosas pupusas.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old and lives with her daughter, son-in-law, and granddaughter. María makes a living through the sales of delicious pupusas (a traditional food prepared from corn dough, beans, cheese, etc.) in the central market of her town. 

Thanks to her charisma and good service, María can count on many customers who look for her products every day. María wishes to invest in her pupusa business since she has seen that the demand has increased, and she wishes to take advantage of the opportunity and so be able to cover a larger section of the market. 

Therefore, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to be able to invest in the purchase of corn, rice, beans, tomatoes, salt, cheese, cabbage, and other products for the production of delicious pupusas.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, beans, tomatoes, salt, cheese, cabbage, and other products to make delicious pupusas.

loans.name: Ana Corazon

texts.en:
Ana Corazon, an industrious mother, lives in Sindangan, Philippines, with her husband and three kids. In order to help the family, she sells food snacks like banana cue and boiled sweet potato. Aside from selling snacks, she operates a sari-sari store.
