In 2014, Ana Corazon became an active member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store because selling food snacks is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future and to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store to increase sales and inventories

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, laundry soaps, biscuits, candies, beverages and seasonings

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phong, born in 1975, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family has a small farm raising pigs and a garden for chickens. But due to the large number of people in the family, the family’s income is just enough to buy food. Her children don’t have enough and necessary conditions for learning. She sees many people in the area raising cows for breeding, so she also wants to buy a cow but she doesn’t have enough money. Knowing the M7 Microfinance Institution Limited, she applied to borrow a loan from the Institution.

She hopes with this loan borrowed, she can buy a heathy cow, and next year this cow will give birth to healthy baby calves. Then, her family will have a better living conditions, and her children can go to school and have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hesila

texts.en:
Hesila is a businesswoman from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 40 years old, married with three children, and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Hesila is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now she applied a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items for the redemption of her coconut farm. Hesila continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase store commodities like canned goods, juice, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 26, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She has two children, ages 4 and 2. One attends school. 

She operates a retail shop, mainly buying and selling general merchandise. She supplements the income earned from the retail shop by farming. 

She hopes to expand her business and pay school fees for her child. Grace will use the loan facility to buy more plastic cups, plates, buckets and jugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plastic cups, plates, buckets and jugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the paperwork to get his driver's license.

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan, born in 1960, is a Kinh person. She lives with her husband and her four children in the Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family’s income is mainly from cultivation and animal husbandry. Each year she can sell some chicken broods and pig herds.  However, due to the large number of children, the income is just enough to cover daily living expenses. 

She is looking to invest in expanding her animal husbandry to increase her family’s income and improve the family life, so she expects to borrow a loan from M7-MFI to invest in chicken and pig raising.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her animal husbandry

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Syombua has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to pay school fees and use the rest to add stock into her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees and use the rest to add stock into her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing net and use additional capital to buy crab meat

loans.name: Bilta Ancilica

texts.es: Bilta de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, sabiendo que tiene una doble responsabilidad por ser madre soltera, sale todos los días a ganarse la vida como jornalera, además por las tardes vende tortillas en su vivienda, con lo que logra tener un ingreso extra. Bilta desea comprar materiales para reparar el techo de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Bilta is 41 years old and lives in her own home along with her 15-year-old daughter. She is a woman who for a long time has struggled to support her home’s economy, knowing that she has double the responsibility because she is a single mother. She goes out every day to make a living as a day-laborer. Furthermore, in the evenings she sells tortillas from her home, from which she is able to have an extra income.

Bilta wishes to purchase materials to repair the roof of her home, but she does not have the necessary liquidity, because of which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized corrugated metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized corrugated metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own tailoring business for years and she makes a good income from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for others' needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her child with better education. 

To grow her profit, Lailani would like to apply for a new loan. With 40,000 PHP, she could already purchase more quantities of raw materials needed to produce sportswear items, shirts and jogging pants that are usually used for physical activities in school. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lailani hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living condition of her family and give her children a better education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more raw materials and products needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que sale adelante al lado de sus hijos, apoyada solamente en su negocio de compra y venta de verduras, el cual realiza en un lugar de mucha afluencia de personas, dicha actividad ella ya tiene mucho tiempo de realizarla por lo que ya cuenta con clientes que esperan por sus productos. Ana desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos, ya que solo invirtiendo en esos materiales podrá reparar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado por lo que desea repararlo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Anna, 32 years old, lives in her own home along with her two sons who are 16 and 10 years old. She is a woman who succeeds at the side of her sons, supported only by her business buying and selling vegetables, which she performs in a place with a large number of people. She has already performed this activity for a long time because of which she already has customers who wait for her products. 

Ana wishes to acquire a loan from FUSAI to invest in corrugated metal, wood, and nails, since with just investing in these materials she will be able to repair the roof of her home, which is deteriorated. Therefore, she wishes to repair it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in corrugated metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. He is a hardworking man who does farming alongside motorcycle transport. He needs a loan to buy seeds for planting. He desires to buy land and build his permanent house, but faces the challenge of inadequate capital and bad roads that cause motorcycle breakdowns, leading to expenses in motorcycle repair.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ibania

texts.es:
Ibania es de la ciudad de Concepción, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y de aquí a tres años quiere lograr todo por  lo que hasta ahora está luchando.
Es una persona que está dando todo de si para ser una profesional digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Ibania is from the city of Concepción and is studying to become a business manager.  She’s in her third year and wants to achieve everything she is striving for.

She is one who is giving her all in order to have a good profession.

She is asking for this loan in order to cover her tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shampoo, bath soap, detergent, canned goods, chips, biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a hardworking man who runs a poultry business alongside his motorcycle transport business. He desires to expand his business. He started the business to generate more income for his family despite facing the challenges of inadequate capital and competition, affecting his business profitability.

Gerald needs a loan to buy chicken feeds.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for his poultry business.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.es: Tabita: Es una señora alegre, amable, tiene 53 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 15 años estableció  su pequeño negocio de ropa usada. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas: Una paca mixta, una paca de hogar, una paca de ropa para niños, niñas y adolescentes de short, camisetas. Su sueño es ampliar su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Tabita is a happy and kind woman. She is 53 years old, native to Puerto Cabezas. She has 6 children who are older in age. With the intention of having her own source of income, 15 years ago she established a small business selling used clothing.

She is requesting funding to purchase merchandise in Managua to sell at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas: a mixed pack, a pack for the home, a pack of clothing for boys, girls, and adolescents of shorts and t-shirts. Her dream is to expand her concrete home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in Managua to sell at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas.

loans.name: Nesraim

texts.en:
Nesraim, who is married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, knew she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum MPC. She decided to start a hog-raising business after learning she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Nesraim has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, all repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, Nesraim requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for the proper and rapid growth of her hogs. This will give her income a big boost. 

Nesraim wishes to continue managing her business as effectively as possible so that she can provide better living conditions and a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of feeds and animal vitamins for the proper and rapid growth of her hogs

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Mazingira Group

texts.en:
Mfaume, who is in his mid 40s, is married with three children; two of them are in school and one is still small. He has been running two projects: a genge duka (grocery store) and tent cover rentals for 11 years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mfaume's 17th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the genge stock, opened the duka (small neighborhood sore) and bought tent covers for renting. 

He is really doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. The group is happy. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought a TV set, a deck, an amplifier and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in the genge duka and to buy another tent cover. He dreams of building his own house. 

Mfaume will share this loan with his loan group, "Mazingira," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the genge duka (grocery store) and to buy another tent cover.

loans.name: Liliana Alexandra

texts.es: Liliana una joven de 20 años que estudia la carrera de Idiomas como el francés e Ingles. Liliana pasa al 4to ciclo en sus estudios donde todo le va bien gracias a su constante dedicación y empeño. Actualmente apoya a sus padres en el hogar. Agradece a  su madre, pues es ella quien le brinda su apoyo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de sus pensiones de estudio. El deseo de Liliana es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser competitiva en su especialidad, para luego insertarse al mercado laboral. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar  a jóvenes como ella.
texts.en: Liliana is 20 years old and is studying Languages such as French and English. Liliana has completed the 4th cycle of her studies and everything is going well thanks to her constant dedication and determination. She currently helps her parents in their home. She is grateful to her mother as she is the one who offers her support. The loan that she is requesting will be used to pay the tuition for her studies. Liliana's desire is to satisfactorily complete her studies and be competitive in her specialty so she can enter the labor market.. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for supporting young people like her.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her studies.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Ella es una joven que demuestra su tenacidad al sacar adelante sola a su hija, apoyada en su negocio de venta de flores gracias a él que ha logrado sostener a su hija que es lo más importante que ella tiene. Rosa se siente preocupada ya que la puerta de su vivienda se encuentra en mal estado por lo que ella desea repararla lo antes posible y así darle una mayor seguridad a su familia y a sus pocas pertenencias, ella sabe que no podrá hacerlo sin el apoyo de una institución, por lo que se acerco a solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ángulos de hierro y mano de obra para reparar la puerta de la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, lives in her own house with her young daughter, age 3.  She's a young woman who has the tenacity to get ahead on her own with her daughter, supported by her business selling flowers.  Thanks to her business she has been able to support her daughter, who's the most important thing she has.

Rosa's concerned because the door to her house is in bad shape.  She wants to repair it as soon as possible so she can provide better security for her family and their few belongings.  She knows she won't be able to do that without institutional support, so she went to FUSAI to request a loan to buy metal braces and pay for labor to repair the entry door to her house.

loans.use: to buy metal braces and to pay for labor to repair a door

loans.name: Fatiya

texts.en:
Fatiya is married with six children, four of whom go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market and has been in this business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and sweet  potatoes. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  

She is aspiring of educating her remaining children up to university level. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence used the previous loan to add stock of general merchandise to sell. Still in the same businesses of running a retail shop alongside a tea room, she complains of limited space to meet the demand of her increasing customers, and high rental and license fees. 

Her vision is building a permanent home. 

Florence has asked for a loan to add more stock like water, salt, jelly and other items to sell.

loans.use: to add more stock like water, salt, jelly and other items to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
El Joven Luis Alfredo tiene 27 años de edad vive en una comunidad de Trojes al oriente de Honduras, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 15 años,  vive con su esposa y por los momentos no tiene hijos, su pequeña ganadería ha crecido gracias a su experiencia y voluntad en su trabajo.
Luis está solicitando el préstamo para compra de novillos para engorde y de esta manera tener más producto para ofrecerles a sus clientes que le visitan constantemente para obtener sus productos, espera también que gracias a la inversión que realice a su negocio mejore un poco su condición económica y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es ser un buen ganadero.


Trojes, Honduras -  Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 27 years old and he lives with his wife in a community of Trojes, in eastern Honduras. He has no children yet.

He has worked for fifteen years in agriculture and cattle raising. His small livestock business has grown thanks to his experience and willingness to work.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy calves to fatten. He will then have more product to offer his customers who arrive steadily to buy from him.

He also hopes that the investment on his business will bring him a bit better financial situation and quality of life. His dream is to be a good cattle rancher.

Trojes, Honduras. September 2014.

loans.use: to buy calves for his business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a fruit and vegetables selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Aralez village in the Ararat region. She lives there with her big and nice family of six others: her husband, three children, a daughter-in-law and a 2-year-old grandchild.
 
Alvard, besides her work at a local kindergarten, is also running their family farm. She cultivates tomatoes and some fruit trees (peach, cherry, apple). The main profit comes from the grape orchard that is located near the house where Alvard lives. To be able to solve problems connected with the grape orchard, Alvard asks for this loan. She needs to purchase wires, fertilizer and pesticides for the grape orchard. 

She received a prior loan from a local financial institution but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work in recent times, Alvard was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for wires, fertilizer and pesticides for the grape orchard

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is aged 29 and still single. He owns and manages a transportation business in his village, particularly motorcycle transport. He's been in this business for almost two years and earns a net income of 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. 

Due to insufficient funds, he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has one buffalo and one cow for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has seven children; five of them are school-going. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan, and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Ngik's Group

texts.en:
Ngik is aged 40 years and married with five children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by farming rice and raising pigs and chickens. To supplement the income, she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns them about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the fourth loan for Ngik with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ngik wants to use her portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes to have it for using in her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 42 years old and the mother of three children. For ten years, Sajida has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. 

Now she has five cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another cow to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales.

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es: Elmer de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para llevar a los empleados de una empresa a su lugar de trabajo, pero además en horas de medio día vende bebidas frías y atoles, lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos. Elmer es un hombre feliz con su trabajo ya que le gustan las ventas por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas frías  y los ingredientes para preparar el atoles que tanto gustan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elmer, age 35, lives in his own house with his wife and his 11 year old child.  He is a man who gets up very early every day in order to take the employees of a company to their work place.  

Also, in the midday hours he sells cold drinks and ‘atole’ [hot drink made from maize].  This allows him to have better earnings.  Elmer is a man who is happy with his work because he likes sales.

He has therefore made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy cold drinks and the ingredients to prepare the atoles that his customers like so much.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks and the ingredients to prepare 'atoles'.

loans.name: Sahab  Khatoon

texts.en:
Sahab Khatoon , age 51, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Sahab Khatoon needs to improve her business to help with her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as calves and heifers for resale. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as calves and heifers for resale.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Sololá se caracteriza por ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticada. El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de José albañil de 41 años de edad con una familia de 3  hijos, el primer hijo ya tiene familias separadas y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza es la albañilería el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 7 años y se a convertido en una muy buena fuente de ingresos par el y su familia,  el es muy dedicado a su trabajo lo realiza de la forma más correcta y rápida para dejar las construcciones de su comunidad muy bien hechas.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de herramientas de albañilería para poder trabajar y realizar su trabajo con más rapidez y bien hecho, uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio y que ellos estudien para que sean profesionales en el mañana.
texts.en:
Sololá is a well populated city with modern, well constructed houses built from very sophisticated materials. Social economic development has been a major factor but also the labor supplied by bricklayers and master builders as is the case with José.

He is a 41 year old bricklayer who has a family of three children. The oldest child has their own independent family and the other two are excellent students at the school in their community. The work that he does is as a bricklayer which he has done for 7 years. This work has converted into a good source of income for himself and his family. He is very dedicated to his work and does it in the quickest and most correct way to ensure that the constructions in his community are well made.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase tools for bricklaying so he can do his work and work rapidly and with quality. One of his dreams as time goes by is to become a master builder and teach his children the same trade. He wants his children to study to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy bricklaying tools.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 34-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She maintains her household activities properly. 

Nargis has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. She is a well-trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day-by-day. Nargis requires some salon-related items such as facial creams, combs, furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc., so Nargis made contact to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her beauty salon

loans.name: Sokhy's Group

texts.en:
Sokhy is 37 years old and married. She is a mother of one child. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 19 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR. 

Sokhy is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to use

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Bensodia Group

texts.fr:
BENSODIA  est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de BAMANANKING. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne deux enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de produits cosmétiques à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première  personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING, qui est l’un des quartiers de OUELESSEBOUGOU, commune rurale dudit lieu dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de produits cosmétiques : parfum, mèche, pommade et encens.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité importante de produits cosmétique de différentes sortes (parfum, pommade et déodorant traditionnel).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Bensodia Group is affiliated with the Danaya Association in Bamananking. This group is made up of women who know each other through the bonds of family and community. On average, each group member is 42 years, married, with an average of two children each. They each carry out different activities, such as buying and selling cosmetic products. This is the main source of income for Mariam, the woman sat to the left of the photo. These women all live within large traditional families in Bamananking, one of the districts of Ouelessebougou, a rural commune within Kati Prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

These women have worked in small-scale retail for several years and are very much sought-after for the cosmetic products they trade in, such as perfume, hair extensions, ointments and incense. In order to satisfy their customers' growing needs, the members of this group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso Lending Scheme two years ago. This will be their fifth group loan.

Mariam, who is the group's president and who is very well known around Ouelessebougou, excels in selling cosmetic products. She plans on using her part of the loan to purchase a large quantity of different cosmetic products, such as perfumes, ointments and traditional deodorants. She gets her supplies in Bamako from the wholesalers there and sells these items in Ouelessebougou in exchange for both cash and credit to a mixed customer base.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay back the loan and reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Humera

texts.en:
Humera is 23 years old and single. For the past four years, she has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Humera requested her fourth loan for 45,000 PKR, which she wills use to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. Humera expects a boost in her earnings with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, onion, melons, watermelon, avocados, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Malachi

texts.en:
Malachi is a 40-year-old man married to Caroline who supports their family welfare. They have been blessed with one child.   

Malachi has been operating a motorcycle transport business for nine years, earning himself an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Malachi was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy an additional motorcycle to facilitate transport for his daily progress. 

The profits he earns will be used to expand her wife’s green grocery business and educate his child. He hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Na is a 34-year-old mother of three children.

The main sources of family’s income are from growing cassava and working for others for a fee. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the second loan for Na with VisionFund. She successfully paid back her previous loan with VisionFund.
 
Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shaheena

texts.en:
Shaheena is a 37-year-old married woman who always wanted to educate children in need. 

She has been running a school for 10 years. An energetic and hardworking woman, she is committed to continually improving her school to build her school's reputation in the community. 

There are over 200 students in her school. She needs to build two new classrooms to make the school's environment comfortable for the students in order to improve learning outcomes and general well being. To accomplish her goal, she applied for loan of PKR 100,000.

loans.use: to build two new classrooms to make the school's environment comfortable for the students.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 30-year-old married woman. 

Shamshad had dreamed of starting a school to educate children in need in her community. Four years ago, she turned her dream into a reality and opened her school. Seeing the determination and the hard work Shamshad had put in, her brother and husband joined the school management to help her. Today, there are 140 students studying in the school. Shamshad has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 in order to provide her students with a computer lab and to buy furniture so that they can learn comfortably. 

Having accomplished her dream of opening a school, Shamshad now wants to continually improve her school to benefit her students. She wants to give them a good future, and she believes the first step is a good education.

loans.use: to provide her students with a computer lab and to buy furniture so that they can learn comfortably.

loans.name: Saddiqa

texts.en:
Saddiqa is 41 years of age. 

Her great skill in hand embroidery and an experience of 20 years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand-embroidered cloth has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her six children. 

Saddiqa is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 55,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expense.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a 52-year-old, hardworking, married woman. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. 

Mukhtar is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last eight years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle and has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc. This monetary help can take Mukhtar closer to her dream of providing better living conditions to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is the age of 52, a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits and vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits and vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit and vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. Therefore, Irshad asked for loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fruits and vegetables for selling.

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 44 years old, is married, and has two children. She is a vegetable vendor, while her spouse is a farmer. Her daughter, Joyce Ann, is an agricultural engineering student who wants to become successful someday.

Josefina wants to help achieve her daughter's dream but has insufficient funds to pay tuition fees, so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay tuition fees. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
The Litein area of Kenya is an area that constitutes wrenching statistics of people. In this area, hard-core poverty pervades every homestead, yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people: a sea of about 50,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it is possible. They are like the bones in the “valley of dry bones” that required only a breath to spring back to life. 

Gilbert, 34, is a small-holder farmer who has been practicing mixed farming on a small inherited piece of land. Gilbert is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, mentor, and an inspiration to many youths in the Litein area due to his resilience to personal challenges and his passion to serve his fellow youth and one child as a primary caregiver.

Back in 2002, Gilbert practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was doing only 1/4 an acre of maize crop per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely survive. He kept doing maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2008, when he switched to tea, poultry and dairy farming and there was light at the end of the tunnel for Gilbert. 

Today, Gilbert is arguably the most successful client of Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance institution that deals only with small-holder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. He is a full-fledged entrepreneur, having already serviced four asset-based loans. Through the loans he has acquired a motor vehicle that he uses to transport farm produce from the farm to the market.

To capitalize more on returns from the booming tea, dairy and poultry farming, Gilbert is seeking a loan of KES 300,000 to buy land. Through the loan he will be able to expand his tea plantation, have enough space to keep more poultry and dairy cows so as to meet the overwhelming demand he has.

The Litein area has a ready market for milk, poultry, and tea and a large population. Hence, Gilbert will not have a problem selling the products and increasing his income level. Gilbert is much disciplined with finances and he is sure that, through accumulated profits, he will buy more land and be able to pay the loan on time.

With the loan, Gilbert is going to improve his living conditions and also improve the conditions of his child by providing him with a solid education, because education is the “key to success.”

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 39-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

With her husband, Farzana has been doing agriculture work for many years. They grow different vegetables and fruit and then sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds, along with insecticide and pesticide, Farzana applied a loan of PKR 55,000. This would help her to grow more crops which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, along with insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 46 years old and married. She operates a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews them, and sells them to the people of her locality. She has a great product selection earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Kaneez requested her fourth loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, candy, plantains, yuca, etc.

loans.name: Aldrene

texts.en: Aldrene is 18 years old and lives in Cattaran with his family. He is a college student studying for his Bachelor of Science in Criminology. His parents have an unstable income so he requested an educational loan for 7,000 PHP, which he will use to pay his tuition fees. Aldrene's parents are very supportive of his dreams and they promise to pay the loan in full.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients and tools for making dairy products

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia de 43 años de edad es una mujer tenaz que habita en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace 26 años, acompañada de su esposo y su hija de 16 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y panes desde hace 20 años los que luego de preparar vende en su comunidad y en el negocio de su esposo que cuenta con un centro de entretenimiento en su domicilio. Emilia gracias a su amabilidad y el buen sabor que pone a sus productos por lo que sus clientes siempre buscan sus productos, y es por ello que desea invertir en el, pero al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, cebolla, chile verde, harina, maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Emilia, 43, is a strong woman who has lived for 26 years in a house that's modest but her own.  She lives with her husband and her 16-year-old daughter.

She has earned a living for 20 years making and selling tamales and bread in her community and in her husband's business, an entertainment center in their home.  Customers always seek out Emilia's products, thanks to her friendliness and the good flavor she puts into her food.

Emilia wants to invest in her business but doesn't have the necessary economic liquidity.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, green peppers, flour, corn, and so on.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, green peppers, flour, corn, etc.

loans.name: Jose Esli

texts.es:
El Joven José de 26 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes al oriente de Honduras y se dedica a la reparación y venta de repuestos de vehículos, es soltero y vive con sus padres.
José le brinda apoyo económico a sus padres gracias a  su negocio el cual ha crecido gracias a su experiencia y esfuerzo, el era empleado de una empresa y ahora tiene su propio negocio, necesita el préstamo para la compra de llantas, llaves, soldadoras, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
The young Jose, who is just 26 years of age, lives in the community of Trojes, in eastern Honduras and dedicates himself to repairing vehicles as well as selling [replacement] parts. He is single and lives with his parents.

Jose provides economic assistance to his parents, thanks to his business, which has grown due to his experience and efforts. He used to be employed by a business, but now he has his own business. Jose needs the loan to purchase tires, wrenches, solder, etc., and he hopes that the investment will permit him to advance his business and improve, little by little, his quality of life as well as that of his family.

Trojes, Honduras – September 2014

loans.use: buy tires, wrenches, solder, etc., for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is in her early 40s, single, and has three children who attend school.  She operates two businesses, a grocery store and a catering business, which she has been doing for four years.  She works from 4 PM to midnight every day and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.  

Sophia requested her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to purchase items for her grocery store and catering business.  She used the previous loans to increase her grocery stock and start her catering services.  She used the profit to pay school fees; bought a sofa set, fridge, and cupboard for clothes; and covered household expenses.  She dreams of owning a bar business.

loans.use: to purchase items for her grocery store and catering business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 41 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 15 años y dos hijas de 10 años y 4 meses de edad. Margarita se dedica a la venta de pan dulce desde hace 11 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Margarita desea mejorar sus ventas por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pan dulce para la venta y así poder aumentar sus ventas y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Margaret is 41 years old and has a 15 year old son, a 10 year old daughter, and a 4 month old daughter. Margaret has made a living selling sweet bread for the past 11 years. She makes her sales door to door, and in doing so supports her family. Margarita wants to improve her sales, which is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase more bread to sell, so she can increase sales and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet bread to sell.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Это Махсуда, ей 33 года. Она является матерью одиночкой. Махсуда живет в районе Шахритус вместе с двумя несовершеннолетними сыновьями и матерью. Сейчас Махсуда заново начинает свой торговый бизнес. Дело в том, что она прекратив свою деятельность, уехала в Россию и некоторое время находилась там для заработки. Теперь Махсуда вернулась в свою родную страну и не собирается больше покидать его. Махсуда хочет возобновить свой старый бизнес по купле и продаже фруктов. У нее есть торговая точка на рынке и немного сбережения. Из-за нехватки финансов для привоза товара, она обратилась за кредитом. Махсуда в семье единственный добытчик. Ваша финансовая поддержка очень необходима для нее, чтобы обеспечить себя работой, а семью источником дохода.
texts.en:
This is Makhsuda. She is 33 and a single mother. She lives in the Shahrituz region with her mother and her two young sons. Makhsuda is currently restarting her own retail business. She had shut down the business and spent some time working in Russia but has returned to her native country and doesn't want to leave it again. 

Makhsuda wants to restart her old business buying and selling fruit. She has a retail spot at the market and some money saved. But since she doesn't have enough to purchase inventory, she is looking for a loan. She is the only breadwinner in her family and your financial support is very important to her so she can have a means of earning a living and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a shipment of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Emanuel” la cual está conformado por 06 socios progresistas y emprendedores. Hilda de 28 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Gracias a su permanente dedicación puede cubrir con los gastos de su hogar. Su mayor deseo es darles una mejor educación a sus menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pescado, papa, camote, arroz y aceite. El grupo “Emanuel” Agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Hilda es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
This is the "Emanuel" Group which is composed of six progressive and enterprising members. 

Hilda is 28 years old and separated from her husband with two dependent children. She sells meals. Thanks to her enduring dedication, she manages to cover her household expenses. Her greatest desire is to offer a better education to her minor children. 

Hilda is requesting her loan to purchase fish, potatoes, sweet potatoes, rice and cooking oil.  She is the third person from the left and is wearing the sky blue t-shirt.

The "Emanuel" Group is thankful to all the Kiva investors for facilitating this loan.

loans.use: buy fish, potatoes, sweet potatoes, rice and cooking oil to cook meals to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a little sari-sari store business in Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now she availed a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Leonila hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Sirley lives at Amulung with her family. She raise hogs for income while her spouse is a farmer. They have unstable income, but they are willing to sustain their children’s education. Shirley’s daughter is a first year student studying for a Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. 

Shirley is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to pay tuition fees and an allowance at school. This will help provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and an allowance at school

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 54, is a mother of five children living in Kampong Chhnang province. Nowadays, she needs to support three schoolchildren. She grows rice as her single source of income to support her family's condition. She can earn income about 9 USD per day. This is second time for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house has electricity to use as other houses.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a farmer from Thuita village in the central region of Kenya. For 20 years, he has depended on mixed-farming as a family man to look after his wife and four children. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, vegetables and other crops. He is also involved in temporary side-businesses.
 
In the past, Albert has invested a lot of time and effort in crop cultivation. As much as he enjoyed and felt passionate about the activity, frequent occurrences of dry spells and market uncertainties messed things up for him and his dependants. Albert shifted his focus to a section of his business that he for the first time saw was close to being risk-free and very reliable... poultry. On closer look, the free-range hens on the farm were busy wandered about fending for themselves, laying eggs, hatching chicks, dropping manure on his farm and also aerating the soil while looking for bugs. He started treating poultry farming not as a subsistence activity, but as a business. 

Albert is seeking a loan to acquire more poultry. This is in a bid to scale the poultry business into a big business. Additional income from the investment will go to his children's school fees and other family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing an electrical generator, in addition to more equipment, tools and cosmetics that will help her fulfill her clients’ demands

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo lives in Capatan with his family. He manages a hog raising business. He takes care of his hogs so they grow healthier and offers them at a higher price. 

Marcelo requested a loan for 40,000 PHP, which he will use to buy hog feed, medicine, and vaccines. These items will help his hogs grow. He hopes that with continuous maintenance of his business he will achieve financial stability, which will allow him to give his family a better way of life.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, medicine, and vaccines

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching, age 38, engages in fishing to earn an income. She catches fresh fish and sells them to members of her local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost 15 years. In addition to fishing, Ching engages in dried fish vending. Ching lives with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have five children. Their eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 4. 

Ching is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 in order to buy a pump boat and compressor (to power a gas turbine) and to use as additional capital to purchase dried fish. These materials will help her to increase her ongoing catch and sell more dried fish.

In the future, Ching would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a pump boat, compressor (to power a gas turbine) and to purchase additional dried fish

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy, 46, is a mother of five school-aged children, living in Kampong Chhnang province. 

She earns income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping on 1.5 hectares of land and via fish-raising. This is Suy's fourth cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

Suy will spend her loan to buy solar panels. She hopes that her house will have electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy solar panels.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Tralach District

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria makes a profit growing rice and has a palay trading business to sell rice. She will use 50,000 PHP to renovate her home with new roofing and a wide space to store rice,

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing and a successfull repayment record. 

Sshe is thankful that all her financing needs where supported by PMPC. In the future she wants to become a supplier of rice in nearby municipalities.

loans.use: for pay for house renovation to include a wide space to store rice.

loans.name: Levinia

texts.en:
Levinia  is passionate about selling. She is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines.

She runs a store that primarily supports her family and never tires of operating her store. Levinia  is a full fledged member of PMPC and has repaird  several loans. She religiously paid her obligations without default. She requests a loan to buy sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. A good inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe  is 54 years old and has two children.  Felipe  sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  

He has been a Paglaum MPC  member in good standing for almost 3 years and wants a 20,000 PHP loan  to purchase  new nets.  They have to have the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  He has floaters to help guard the fish cages and wants to buy the  neighbors' catch and sell  to the nearby fish market to fetch higher prices.  

In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  He wishes to see his children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Jeremiah from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Jeremiah is 32 years old and a proud father of two lovely angel-looking children whom he really adores and cherishes. Other than doing some small business, Jeremiah is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past two years. He has gained so much experience through those years of farming. 

Jeremiah practices mixed farming. That is, he grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities he has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his chickens Lelmet. He really enjoys taking care of his poultry. 

Although Jeremiah has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. His farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why he is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to be able to buy farm implements. 

Through the loan, Jeremiah will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Jeremiah will reap more, which will assure him of comfortably taking care of his family and repaying the loan. Jeremiah's plan is to be able to increase his farming and to be able to save more money so that he can buy more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 42-year-old man married to Naomi who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with four children. Thomas has been a landlord  for  seven years and  earns 5,000 KES  every month.
  
Thomas was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and requests 30,000 KES to buy iron sheets, timbers, nails and metal doors.

Thomas plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to his children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, timbers, nails and metal doors.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is driven by passion to sell. At the age of 68 and a widow in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. She never gets tired of tending her store. 

Anselma is a fully-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. 

Now, she is borrowing another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, Anselma dreams of sustaining her store, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seafood, such as: fish, shells, prawn, crab, etc.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth grew up with many sisters and was mesmerized at the way they loved to look good.  They paid attention to their hair, face, and nails.  This  motivated him to begin a beauty salon that would meet the needs of ladies. 


He has managed to attract many customers and grow the business because of his passion. He  wants to buy a pedicure machine and good driers to provide quality service to his many customers. He is sure of success and  is hard working

loans.use: to buy standard salon equipment.

loans.name: Baranaba

texts.en:
Baranaba is a farmer who lives in the village of  Bokisaba  near the town of Nyamira  in Kenya. Baranaba has 10 children.

He has supported his family in the last two decades through mixed-farming. His primary income sources are selling milk and tea. He also makes significant money selling eggs. 

Baranaba would love to expand his poultry business to make more profit.  He does have limited funds and needs 30,000 KES to purchase more poultry. This loan will totally transform his business. He will be able to sell crates of eggs each blessed day. 

Barnaba will use the income from this investment to repay his loan, support his family, and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricklaying tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, plantains, bananas, avocados, onions, etc.

loans.name: Morena Del Trancito

texts.es: Morena de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 15, 9 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que observando que en su comunidad había la necesidad de una tienda de productos básicos decidió instalar una en su vivienda, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado apoyar a su esposo con lo gastos económicos. Morena desea construir un muro de retención en su vivienda, para proporcionarle mayor seguridad sobre todo por sus hijos que son lo más importante en su vida. Por lo anterior Morena solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, piedra y hierro para construir un muro de retención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Morena is 33 years old and she lives with her husband and three children who are 15, 9 and 4 years old. She is an enterprising woman who saw that there was a need for basic necessities in her community, and so, she opened a store that she runs from her house. Thanks to to her business, she is able to help her husband with household expenses.

Morena wants to build a retention wall to protect her home, and her children, who are the most important thing in her life. Morena is asking for a loan to purchase cement, sand, gravel, stone, and iron to build the retention wall previously mentioned.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, stone, and iron to build a retention wall for her home.

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es: Adriana de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 17 y 19 años de edad que han sido la razón de sus esfuerzos. Ella es una mujer que por circunstancias de la vida tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijas ella sola apoyada en su trabajo como consultora comunitaria lo que también demuestra que es una mujer solidaria. La vivienda de Adriana se encuentra en un terreno bastante quebrado por lo que ella desea construir un muro de retención para que esto no cause que su vivienda corra riesgo, además le dará una mayor seguridad y privacidad a su vivienda, pero Adriana no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para realizar dicha inversión. Es por lo anterior que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, piedra y hierro para construir un muro de retención.
texts.en:
Adriana is 42 years old and she lives with her two daughters who are 17 and 19 years old. They are the reason she works so hard. She has found herself in the situation of having to raise her children as a single mother. She is able to support her family thanks to a job she has at a community clinic, a job that also demonstrates her commitment to the community.

Adriana's home is located on an unstable piece of land, and so she wants to build a retention wall so that her home will not be in harm's way. The wall will provide her with more security and privacy. Unfortunately, Adriana does not have enough liquid assets to cover the expenses on her own. And so, she is applying for a loan through FUSAI so can purchase cement, sand, gravel, stone and iron to build the retention wall.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, stone and iron to build a retention wall.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
SEWA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de BAMANANKING. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de SATA  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING, qui est l’un des quartiers de OUELESSEBOUGOU commune rurale dudit lieu, dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : balle de tissus et prêt à porter.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
SATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  3 pièces de tissus et une quantité importante de prêt à porter.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The SEWA group is part of the DANAYA association of BAMANANKING. It consists of married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 25 years of age and three children each. They practice various activities including the purchase and sale of clothing through SATA, standing 1st  from the left in the group photo. They live in large traditional families in BAMANANKING, a district of the rural commune of OUELESSEBOUGOU, prefecture of KATI (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 

They have been engaged in small trade for many years and they are in high demand for their purchase and sale of clothing, namely their bales of fabrics and their ready-to-wear apparel. 

In an effort to meet their customers’ increasing demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 2nd group loan cycle.  

SATA, the group’s president, is well known around OUELESSEBOUGOU and highly skilled at selling clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy three pieces of fabric and a large stock of ready-to-wear clothing. She buys her merchandise in BAMAKO and from local wholesalers, and she retails it to a mixed clientele in OUELESSEBOUGOU, cash or credit.    

Sata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jean Alien

texts.en:
Jean Alien earns a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is  60 years old and married.  She never tires of operating her store and is passionate about selling.  She earns a meager income and sufficiently supports her family. 

Jean Alien is a full fledged member of PMPC and has had several loans. She maintains her membership in good standing and has applied for a loan to restock her store  to increase inventories and sales. 

Jean Alien continues to look for better business opportunities and has the determination to make ends meet.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and  consumable items.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 29 years old, married, and lives at Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She raises pigs and wants to earn more.

She obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed and requests  3,000 PHP to buy additional feed.

 She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to provide sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could receive financial assistance for her chosen business. Marilyn has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Marilyn wishes to continue managing her business effectively with the support of her family to sustain the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins to sustain the family's needs

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is married with seven children. She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand her storage area and she can now store up to 10,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells to small businesses in the zone.

She needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to buy charcoal to sell to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sergio Omar

texts.es:
Sergio de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado de educación básica. Actualmente esta soltero. El vive con su mamá y dos hermanos. 

Sergio vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de la ciudad desde hace 6 años. Lo aprendió por medio de su mamá ya que ella anteriormente tenía su puesto en el mercado. También es agricultor de maíz y frijol. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos y verduras para su negocio.  El planea que su negocio crezca y que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y así tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Sergio is 38 years old.  He studied through the third grade in elementary school.  He is currently single, and lives with his mother and two siblings.

Sergio has been selling fruits and vegetables in the city marketplace for six years.  He learned this line of work from his mother, because she had had a stand in the market previously.  He is also a farmer of corn and beans.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy fertilizers for his crops and vegetables for his business.  He plans for his business to grow and for his crops to develop in good order.  In this way he will have additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: From Silanga Tangub City, Ellen, a widow, earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds in her business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell to generate more income. Ellen hopes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en: Fegauiai is a 47-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Fegauiai needs a loan to buy yeast, bags of flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, a strainer, and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Fegauiai has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy yeast, bags of flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, a strainer, and a new oven

loans.name: Sofig

texts.en:
Sofig is 58 years old and married with two children. His son is married and his daughter goes to school (10th grade). Sofig’s wife is a housewife. He and his family are Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) from Fuzuli city. He now lives in Kurdmahmudlu village of the Fuzuli region with his large and lovely family. 

Sofig has a car and has been a taxi driver for 10 years. Sofig transports passengers between different areas of the Fuzuli region and between Baku and Fuzuli. Sofig wants to change the tires on his car, and for that he has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 700 AZN. Sofig says thank you to Kiva and the lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to change the tires on his car

loans.name: Saidhuja

texts.en:
Saidhuja is 36 years old and married;  finished junior college. Saidhuja has  raised livestock for 10 years. Thanks to Saidhuja's hard work, his farm has 4 cows. He raises cows and sells meat in a local market. He has repeat customers.

In order to further develop his business, Saidhuja has applied to the IMON INTERNATIONAL micro-finance institution for 5,000 TJS to purchase 2 cows. 

In the future, he also plans to do major home renovations.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothing items like skirts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan, 45 years old, lives with his wife in a small village of Kampong Cham Province. Bunthan and his wife are farmers in a small rice farmland near their house. This couple has two dependent children. They have been involved in this career since 1990 and their average income is $5.00 USD a day.

Currently, he is borrowing a KIVA loan, which is his sixth circle loan, to buy a plot of farmland. With the support from this loan, he hopes that it can help to increase his income and make his life get better. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Tharom

texts.en:
Tharom (in photo) is 23 years old and single. She lives with her family in Phnom Penh City. 

Tharom is a student. She studies at a university in Phnom Penh in year one, semester one, in the field of banking and finance. In addition, she has been a cashier at Tela Mart for three years and her mother has sold roast beef in her own business for 15 years. 

Tharom would like to apply for a loan to pay her school fees. Then, she hopes that after graduation from the university, she wants to become an accountant in a bank.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees for one year.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia earns a living offering printing and photocopying services.  She is married and lives in Barangay 7, Tangub City. She is well known for the nice quality of printing  and earns  6,000 PHP per month.

 Remegia requests 20,000 PHP to buy additional bond paper, special paper, news print, and toner for her printing services to maximize production and to accept bulky orders. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few  months. In her 2 previous loans she has never had a delinquency.

 Remegia is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy bond paper, special paper, news print, and toner for her printing services.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is a 67-year-old resident of Dulag, Leyte. Crescencia operates a sari-sari or variety store, where she sell basic household goods like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. She has been operating a sari-sari store for more than five years now. To be able to fill her stock again to its normal activity, Crescencia is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store like bread, rice, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries. These are very helpful for her livelihood and can eventually help cater her daily needs. 

In the future,  Crescencia hopes that with the additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store like bread, rice, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries.

loans.name: Jeanylyn

texts.en:
Jeanylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming of vegetables business.

Jeanylyn has been in this business for eight years and earns more income from raising pigs and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jeanylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming of vegetables

loans.name: Ernanie
