texts.en:
Ernanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ernanie has been in this business for 16 years. She earns additional income from selling prepaid mobile load and motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Suzel

texts.en:
Suzel works hard to support her family. Suzel is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes(she recycled boxes of cigarettes for her business) of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Suzel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina works hard to support her family. Aquilina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Aquilina has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business. Aquilina has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Aquilina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Nhor, 59, is a mother of two children living in Prey Veng province.To make a living, she weaves the cotton scarfs in Cambodia called “krorma” and works for others to earn extra  income. 

For Nhor, this is her first loan with VisionFund. She is the group leader of a group with three members. She will spend her entire loan portion to growing rice to earn additional income and she is going to buy rice seed and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: José Moisés

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado y está soltero. Actualmente trabaja como empleado para una empresa de seguridad. Él vive en casa de su hermana y su cuñado. Desde 6 meses labora en una empresa de seguridad y viaja todos los días de la casa a su trabajo. Su horario de trabajo es rotativo ya que hace turnos de 24  o 12 horas. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para arreglarse la dentadura y pagarle un dinero que le debe a un amigo. El cliente piensa seguir trabajando y estudiando para en un futuro poder comprar un terreno y hacer su casa.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old and single. He was able to finish the 9th grade. He is currently working as an employee for a security company. He lives with his sister and his bother in law. For the past 6 months he has been working at the security company and he goes to work everyday. His daily schedule changes on a rotating basis and he has shifts that range from 12-24 hours.

The loan he is applying for will be used to cover the cost of dental procedures and to repay a personal debt he owes to a friend. He plans to continue working and studying so that he will be able to purchase his own land and build a home in the future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of dental procedures

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and seller by selling noodle at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sharada

texts.en:
Sharada was born and brought up in Shantipura village in Mysore district. She has studied up to tenth grade. At the age of 18, she got married to Ravi and settled in H. Matakere village, which is located at the bank of the river Kapila. 

There is a school up to seventh standard in the village, but for higher studies the children have to go to a nearby village called H. D. Kote, which is eight kms. from this village.

They have one acre of land where they grow cotton, paddy, millet, horse gram, and other vegetables, depending upon the season and rain.

Her son, Abhinandan, is studying in tenth grade, while her daughter, Panchami, is studying in third standard. Their economic condition is very poor. They are living in a small house with asbestos sheet as a roof.

Sharada is a tailor by profession and has been stitching clothes for the past four years. She is requesting a loan to buy garments and tailoring material needed to open a garment shop in a nearby town called Hand Post. Since she knows quite a few people over there, she is confident the business will flourish.

loans.use: to buy garments and tailoring material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for their farm.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuluuntsetseg, 51 years old, lives with her husband in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering transportation services to local people since 1999. Her husband breeds cattle and grows vegetables. Their children all live on their own. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as planks, cement, shingles and fiberglass for house renovations. As a result, she and her husband, who are getting older day by day, will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. /in the profile picture, the borrower is with her husband/

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Marina Estela

texts.es: Marina de 36 años de edad es una mujer que pone todo su esfuerzo para sostener la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo en el que presta sus servicios domésticos, además ella tiene crianza de pollos y gallinas indias lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos, también su hijo la apoya cultivando maíz y frijol para el consumo. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 21 años, además viven con ella sus hijos de 20, 17 y 14 años de edad. Marina desea construir una pila y el corredor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, lámina y clavos para construir una pila y el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marina, who is 36 years old, is a woman who makes every effort to meet her family's financial needs through her work. She offers domestic services and also raises poultry allowing her to get a better income. Her son also provides support by growing corn and beans for consumption. She has lived in her own home for 21 years. Living with her are her children of 20, 17 and 14. Marina wants to build a sink and a corridor in her home. She's therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, laminate and nails to build a sink and a corridor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, laminate and nails to build a sink and a corridor

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Félix se dedica a la agricultura actividad que realiza desde hace 18 años, cuenta con sistema de riego, el cual le garantiza sembrar y cosechar todo el año, sus principales clientes son los compradores de la ciudad de Danli.
Don Félix los trabajos que requiere los cultivos los realiza personalmente,  todos los días de la semana y se levanta desde muy temprano a realizar las labores de campo, necesita el  préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pago de mano de obra, espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus cultivos y también obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Don Félix sueña con poder sembrar más cultivos.

Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Félix works in agriculture, an activity he has been involved with for the past 18 years. He has his own irrigation system, which guarantees a year round planting and harvesting season. His primary customers are from the city of Danli.

Félix works his fields personally, every day of the week. He wakes up very early to go to work in the fields. He needs this loan so he can purchase fertilizer and cover labor costs. He hopes the loan will help him to improve his harvests and to earn more money so he can support his family.

Félix dreams of being able to grow a wider variety of crops.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, fungicides and cover labor costs.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 31 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in the Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Nga operates a food stall selling fish and has been involved in this business for seven years. This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
In 2010, Lydia learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Lydia tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Lydia took a loan for another amount to buy fertilizer for crop production to sustain the demands of her customers. This will help her farming income and give it a big boost. Lydia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crop production to sustain the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta patiently run her retailing business. She is vending ginger, onions, garlic, and lard. Loreta has been in this business three years and most of her income usually goes to the education of her three children. Loreta’s husband is a farmer. Loreta wants a loan amounting P12,000 to buy stocks of ginger, garlic, and lard to sell. She will do her best to expand the business and serve her costumers well in able to satisfy them so they maintain their costumers and continues serving them.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ginger, garlic, and lard to sell.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is gaining a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business.  She is 60 years old and married.  

She never gets tired of tending her store since she has a passion for selling.  She earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports her family. 

Agustina is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventory and sales. 

Agustina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventory and sales.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 42 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependents.

Rosie has been a house helper for more than 12 years already. The couple is also earning income for labor and hauling service for the cocoland owners during harvest with their carabao as the means of transporting the nuts. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair. Rosie has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to engage in a retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia lives in Pagadian City and supports her three daughters by tending a pork and chicken barbeque. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy raw materials such as chicken meat and pork for her barbeque. 

Delia wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as chicken meat and pork for her barbeque business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza has signed up for membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a grocery store business. She has been doing this for 30 years already and is thankful for the capital it extends to a small borrower like her. Flordeliza has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has been making good sales recently. Recently, she requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to increase her inventory in order to serve more customers. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to increase her inventory

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is from Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jocelyn and they have children. Efren has been working as a factory worker since 2012 through the help and assistance of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Efren is part of the Garment Production Department. He is responsible for garment making processes from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging, and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Efren is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Efren is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to any loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every payday.  He looks forward to your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. He will be using the loan for the renewal of license of his motorcycle and also he will buy items that fill the immediate needs of his family, especially his children.

Efren desires to always meet the needs of his family and he is hoping to give her children a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To provide for the needs of his family and to renew license of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Nena

texts.en:
Maria Nena makes a living through her bamboo furniture business. She runs her business in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, she has taken a loan to purchase more bamboo supplies for furniture making. Maria Nena hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, paints for her furniture making business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 35 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City with her husband and two kids. Nena takes care of a fish pond from which she earns added income for the family. She has been doing this type of activity for two years. Recently, she signed up her membership in PMPC and requested a loan to buy additional fingerlings for her fish pond for sale and consumption. In the future, she plans to expand and improve her fish pond to make it a business enterprise.

loans.use: to buy additional fingerlings for her fish pond for sale and consumption.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 48 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 children now at their adult age. 
Merlyn earns a living from hog fattening business for more than 3 years already. Merlyn earns approximately PHP1,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional piglet and the remaining amount for her mortuary renewal. Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and use the remaining amount for renewal of mortuary insurance.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dorotea is 51 years old and has four children who are still in school. At the back of Dorotea is her neighbor who help her in her business.

Dorotea has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.

Dorotea has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Dorotea would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annabel is 50 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Annabel has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Annabel requested a 27,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc., for her business.

Annabel has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, Annabel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc., for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marites is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 60 years old, married, and has five children. One child attends school, Dulcisima works very hard to provide for her family.

Dulcisima has run a general store for 8 years and requests a loan to purchase items to sell.   She sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent, cereal, chocolate drinks, and  canned goods.

Dulcisima would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy coffee, detergent, cereal, chocolate drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en: Melanya lives in the village of Taperakan in the Ararat area  with her husband and 16-year-old daughter. Ten years ago, she and her husband started farming on a piece of land where she grows tomatoes. She earns enough profits to help support her family's standard of living. She would like to expand her output and is requesting a loan for $3000 to buy the fertilizer, fuel and pesticides she needs for her farm. This is Melanya's first loan request, and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative by Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is married with a small baby son. She studies at university. Lusine is earning her master's degree. Lusine's husband is architect working in the local municipality, and Lusine manages to take care of the child and household. 

The loan she requests is needed for covering educational costs. Lusine will be very thankful if lenders support her in her studies and help her to pay for her university tuition.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Sapargul

texts.ru: Сапаргуль, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Сапаргуль среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес, на сегодняшний день, благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве Сапаргуль имеется 7 дойных коров, дополнительно она занимается полеводством, на собственной земле, мерою 0,60 ГА она выращивает клевер. Сапаргуль хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота, в связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства она приобретет одну дойную корову и телят. На доходы от кредита Сапаргуль хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем обеспечить отдельным жильем своих детей.
texts.en:
Sapargul is 44, married, and the mother of three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and has been a crop and livestock farmer for several years.  She's developed her business over time, and, thanks to her persistent and goal-oriented nature, currently has seven dairy cows on her farm, as well as 0.60 hectares of her own land for growing clover.  

Sapargul wants to add more animals to her farm, and is seeking a loan of 130,000 som from Bai-Tushum to do so.  She plans on using any profits due to the loan to buy more livestock, as well as help her children move out and start living on their own in the near future.

loans.use: buy one dairy cow and additional calves in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her cotton candy machine and buy materials for making ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system and save money

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Sary is 26 years old and single. To make a living, she works for others for a fee as her main source of income and grows rice to supplement her income. She can earn income of about 6.00 USD per day. 

This is Sary's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have adequate electricity to use and that she can cut her electric fees to less than before.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Guruswamy

texts.en:
Guruswamy is staying in a small mud house with his parents. The borrower is a dedicated organic farmer growing traditional food crops. Mainly he's been into conservation of traditional vegetable varieties and uncultivated food crops for a long time. 

Guruswamy maintains a home-based seed bank. He has distributed breeder seeds of traditional vegetables, millets, maize and uncultivated crops to several individuals, farmer groups and organizations for conservation and promotion purposes.
 
Guruswamy has received a handful of awards and recognition from the state agriculture dept for his individual efforts and contribution to fostering traditional agro-biodiversity.

Guruswamy is requesting a loan of INR 50000 to establish a traditional vegetable seed farm and purchase basic seed production equipment such as poly sheets for the nursery setup, nursery trays and a small bio digester.

Guruswamy dreams to set up an advanced seed bank under the guidance and support of experts.

loans.use: to purchase poly sheets for a nursery setup and nursery trays to establish a traditional vegetable seed farm

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado. Esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y ella a la venta de ropa. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ellos, 2 de sus hijos estudian bachillerato a distancia y también trabajan. 

Roxana se dedica a la venta de ropa desde 6 años y decidió dedicarse a esa actividad ante la necesidad de llevar un ingreso a su familia. Ella trabaja desde las 7:00 am  hasta las 5:00 pm y a veces su compañero de vida le ayuda en su negocio cuando no trabaja en el campo. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más variedad de prendas de vestir, como faldas, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior de hombre y mujer, pantalones, vestidos, etc ya que se acerca la temporada en que se vende bastante ropa. 

Ella planea seguir trabajando en su negocio y sueña en tener su propio local con mayor mercadería, además de ver a sus hijos crecer y que se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Roxana is 46 years old and was able to finish the 5th grade. She has a common law marriage and her husband works in agriculture. She makes a living by selling clothing. She has 6 children, four of whom live with her and two of whom are finishing their schooling via a long distance program and who work as well.

Roxana has been selling clothing for 6 years. She began her business out of necessity because her family needed a second income to help support it. She works from 7am to 5pm and sometimes her husband helps her when he doesn't have to work in the fields.

The loan will be used to purchase a variety of clothing items like skirts, blouses, shirts, men's underwear, women's underwear, pants, dresses etc. The time of year when she sells the most clothing is approaching.

She plans to continue working and her dream is to have her own store with more merchandise. She also wants to see her children grow and have professional careers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items like skirts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Natalia to improve her business. She sells shoes where many people come to shop every day because her place of business is in the market. She will buy more shoes with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin such as children's shoes, men's shoes, women's shoes and other things to sell. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2006 with her own working capital of $1000. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day, so she is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to improve her business. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes, men's shoes, women's shoes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Juana es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es la  venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año, se levanta muy temprano para elaborar las tortillas, sus clientes principales son personas que viven en su misma comunidad  y también tiene contrato de entrega a una pulpería vecina.
Doña Juana atiende su  negocio de lunes a sábado, solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, cal, etc. materia prima que le permitirá  elaborar las tortillas espera que  a través de las ganancias que obtenga del negocio mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Juana uno de sus sueños es que su negoció crezca y este bien posicionado.

Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre  2014
texts.en:
Juana is an enterprising woman who has her own business selling tortillas. She has been doing this for 1 year. She gets up very early to make tortillas. Her main customers are people who live in the same community; she also has a delivery contract with a local grocery store. 

Juana works from Monday to Saturday. She is asking for a loan to buy corn, wood, lime, etc. which are the raw materials that allow her to make the tortillas. She hopes that - through the profits of the business - she will improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

One of her dreams is that her business grows and becomes established. 

Danlí, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, lime, etc for her business

loans.name: G.s Eben Ezer Group

texts.es:
El Joven Henry se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de tajaditas de plátano, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en su negocio el cual inicio cuando era estudiante.
Henry sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su comunidad y aldeas vecinas con el préstamo espera comprar plátano, aceite, bolsa, sal, leña, etc. para seguir elaborando sus productos y espera obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su negocio.
Doña María Prudencia su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de la venta de tortilla de maíz, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia.
Doña María Dilia su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de  su negocio, venta de verdura y nacatamales tiene 6 años de experiencia. 

Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Henry makes a living by selling cooked plantains. He has been running his business for four years. He began his business when he was still a student.

Henry's primary customers are the people who live in his community and the neighboring areas. With the loan, he will purchase plantains, oil, bags, salt, firewood etc. so he can continue to sell his product. He hoes to earn enough money to expand his business.

Doña María Prudencia is a member of the same bank and she sells corn tortillas, with 5 years of experience. Doña María Dilia is also a member of the same bank and she sells vegetables and tamales, with 6 years of experience.

loans.use: purchase plantains, oil, bags, salt, firewood etc.

loans.name: Artemio Jr.

texts.en: Artemio Jr., 45 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Silanga, Tangub City. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for them. He is earning a living through fishing. To generate more income, Artemio Jr. decided to give it a try to seaweed culture production after he learned that he can avail himself of financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to buy the materials needed for this project. Artemio Jr. smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his seaweed culture production project

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
El campo fértil donde alumbra el sol cada mañana donde los trabajadores hacen presencia para otro día de labrar la tierra y provecharlas al máximo, es el trabajo de Natividad soltero de 39 años motivo por el cual el a acudido a otro préstamo para seguir en el cultivo de papas que el ha venido realizando desde hace un tiempo atrás para el beneficio de su familia y su comunidad.

Cuando no tenía acceso a los préstamos  no producía buena cosecha, pero gracias a los préstamos que el ha venido realizando el a podido tener muy buena cosecha para tener una mejor producción y realizar el cultivo de papas para el beneficio de su comunidad y la de su familia y como una fuente de ingresos económicos.

La inversión que realizara para el nuevo préstamo es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y orgánicos, ya que es muy importante para la producción de papas, para tener  buena cosecha de su familia y comunidad. 

Los cambios que han sucedido en la vida de Natividad por medio de los créditos que se le han otorgado es obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia y obtener mejores cosechas en su comunidad.

Uno de las aspiraciones de Natividad es llegar a la ampliación de sus cultivos de papas para tener mejores ingresos económicos en un futuro y darles educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The fertile field where the sun shines every morning and where the workers show up for another day of tilling the earth, taking full advantage of it, is the work of Natividad.  He is 39 years old and single.  His motivation in taking out another loan is to keep raising potatoes as he has been doing for some time now for the benefit of his family and his community.

When he didn’t have access to a loan, he didn’t produce a good harvest, but thanks to the loans that he has taken out, he has been able to have very good harvests.  This gives him a better yield and he can raise potatoes for the benefit of his community and his family, as a source of income.

The investment he will make with the new loan is to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, because these are very important for his potato production, in order to have a good harvest for his family and his community.

The changes that have taken place in Natividad’s life due to his loans, and which he is very proud of, are having a better income in order to improve the living conditions of himself and his family, and getting better harvests for his community.

One of Natividad’s aspirations is to expand his potato fields in order to have better income in the future, and to give his children an education so that they can be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ran works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Chanra’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chanra works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and ave money on medical expenses

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Ang’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thot's Group

texts.en: Thot’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thot makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as seller buy selling grocery to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anne J.

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Anne. She is married and has four children aged 19, 12, 10, and 4 years. 

In 2001, Anne established her pharmacy business. She began her business because of a low salary income. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are her fellow community members. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business.

Anne has received and completely repaid two loans. Anne now needs a third loan of 5,000,000 SLL to help buy more medicines for her business.

Anne used profit that she generated from her last business to provide a livelihood for her family, pay school fees, and buy learning materials for her children.

In the future, Anne plans to become a drugstore owner and open a pharmacy in a different business outlet.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to resell.

loans.name: Samat's Group

texts.en: Samat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samat works as farmer and she also does extra work as construction worker and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman; she has six children, all of whom attend school. Luvuno owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as construction worker, tailor and village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
