loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 44, is a Palestinian refugee who was born and raised in one of the Palestinian refugee camps located in North Lebanon. He is single and lives alone but is in charge of his mother since his father passed away. 
Ali was raised by his parents with a very limited income, which prevented him from pursuing his studies at school.
In 2008, he established his own business, by opening a shop that sells clothes to women and children at competitive prices.

Throughout the years, and despite many difficulties that Ali has faced due to the Syrian crisis, he succeeded in maintaining a very good reputation in the market as well as with his clients who see him as an honest, ambitious, and organized young man. In fact, mothers from all over the camp come to his shop because his prices are reasonable and flexible and his clothes are suitable for all family members. 

Ali is applying for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow him to increase his stocks in kids clothes, women clothes and towels. He will also be able to serve new customers and reach new areas in the camp which will increase his income and fulfill his ambition of seeing his business grow.

loans.use: to increase his stock in kids and women's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of stock like canned goods, rice, noodles, soap, beverages and to purchase squid.

loans.name: Maria  Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is married, has one child who attends school, and lives in Dinalungan, Aurora.  She operates a sari-sari store. Her husband drives a bus. 

Luisa requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase stocks of commodities such as detergent soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, soap, biscuits, condiments, and canned goods. She believes that many products will result in a higher income. By purchasing stocks of products, her transportation expenses will be lessened. In the future, Luisa hopes to have a computer shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of commodities

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda, 49, is the mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store and he has some relatives who like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, which is why his business is running well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rasheeda requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Rasheeda thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's general store

loans.name: Entisar

texts.en:
Entisar is a 45 year old Palestinian refugee who lives with her husband and their eight children in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. The family is known in the camp for being very hardworking and committed to improving their living conditions despite the daily challenges they face due to socio economic instability in the camp. In fact, her husband works as a tailor and four of her children also started working after graduating from school to support their parents and brothers and sisters. 
Entisar established her own business two years ago. She owns a grocery store in a very popular street of the camp, which attracts a lot of clients during rush hours in addition to her competitive prices. 
She is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow her to increase her stocks and supplies which will positively impact her sales and revenue from the shop. With such a boost to her business, she will be able to continue covering part of her family's expenses and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: increase her stocks in food supplies and cleaning products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, shown in the picture with one of his clients, is a 31 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. He has been married for four years to a young Palestinian from the same camp. Together they have a three year old girl who has just started school. While his wife is unemployed, Mahmoud has been working in the family's Barber shop since he was 17 years old, which makes the salon the family's only source of income. 
Starting his experience as a trainee, Mahmoud was trained by his uncles for several years. He is now the owner of the barber shop and has his own regular clients. His clients see him as an active, perseverant young man who works hard to provide his wife and daughter with improved living conditions. 
Mahmoud is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time for Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to increase his stocks in salon products (shampoo, perfume, cream). This amount will allow him to provide his loyal clients with a better service which will directly impact his monthly income and his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock of salon products

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant à l’image de MASSIRE qui est la seule personne assise sur la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la commune rurale dudit lieu Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités vente dans le restaurant : viandes, haricots et riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
MASSIRE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle de la vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de viandes, choux et poivres pour leur restaurant. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité vente dans le restaurant.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is affiliated with the Siguikafo Association in Tiele. This group is made up of women who know each other through the bonds of family and community. On average, each group member is 37 years old, married, with an average of three children each. They each carry out different activities, such as running their own food stalls. This is the main source of income for Massire, the woman kneeling down in the photo. These women all live within large traditional families in Tiele, within Baguineda Sub-Prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

These women have been carrying out this work for several years and are very much sought-after for the goods they trade in, such as meats, beans and rice. In order to satisfy their customers' growing needs, the members of this group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso Lending Scheme six years ago. This will be their ninth group loan.

Massire, who is the group's president and who is very well-known around Tiele, excels in running her food stall. She plans on using her part of the loan to purchase two sacks of rice and a large quantity of meats, cabbages and pepper. She gets her supplies in Bamako and sells these items in Tiele in exchange for both cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay back the loan and reinvest into her food stall business.

loans.use: to run their own food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet, wood and fastening pins to repair the roof of the bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a dairy unit

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 64 años de edad es una mujer que vive feliz en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años. Ella es una mujer que se gana la vida desde hace 40 años elaborando y vendiendo ropa de cama como: forros de cama, cojines, cortinas, etc. Ana es una mujer que siempre busca la manera de superarse y de mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que ella desea construir una acera en su vivienda, ya que como se puede observar el espacio es pequeño y que da encerrado por lo que el agua se acumula y se filtra y ella tiene el temor que pueda minar su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro para construir una acera en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 64, is a woman who has been living happily in her own home for three years now.

She is a woman who has been making a living making and selling bed linens such as mattress covers, pillows, drapes, and the like. 

Ana is a woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead and improve her living conditions. For this reason, she wants to build a walkway on her property. As it can be seen in the picture, since the space is small and enclosed, water accumulates and seeps into the home, and she is afraid that this may damage her house. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, brick, and rebar to build a walkway on her property.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, and rebar to build a walkway on her property.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is hardworking and resilient. He rears cattle and sells them when he needs cash to meet his family's needs and also when he wants to restock. He is challenged by a capital shortage and with UGAFODE funding this will soon be history. He will use the loan to buy cattle that he will graze on fodder for three to six months and then sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get himself to work.

loans.name: Ziro

texts.en:
Ziro is the married mother of eight children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Ziro dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Hạnh

texts.en:
Hạnh is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks. She has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and water filter. This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and water filter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet, wood and fastening pins to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Sợi

texts.en:
Sợi works in agriculture farming food.

Sợi is 56 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Sợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Sợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Sợi faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water filter.

With her business profit, Sợi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water filter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Duyên works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Duyên is 44 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Duyên faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Duyên hopes to build a new house, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Blas De Jesús

texts.es:
Blas de 54 años de edad,  estudio hasta 8° grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Tienen dos hijos que ya no dependen de él porque están acompañados. 

Blas  se dedica a la compra y venta de hierro y aluminio desde hace muchos años y también se dedica a la agricultura. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar hierro y aluminio, para venderlo a las empresas que compran este material. 

Él planea comprar un carro más grande y poder aumentar sus ingresos para apoyar a su familia en los gastos.
texts.en:
Blas, 54 years old, studied up to 8th grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children who no longer depend on them because they are married. 
Bias has made his living buying and selling iron and aluminum for many years, and he is also involved in farming. 
The loan he is requesting is to buy iron and aluminum to sell to companies that buy this material. 
He plans to buy a bigger car and to increase his income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy iron and aluminum to sell to companies that buy this material.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy, 23, is a young farmer who lives in Ibencho village in the Nyanza province of Kenya. He has an equally young wife and a daughter. Timothy started doing farming eight years ago.  His primary income sources are eggs, tea and other crops. Timothy also holds a day job that pays him a monthly salary. 

Timothy is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He has been meaning to purchase a cow for a while now but he is constrained by the lack of capital. He is fully prepared for this additional responsibility as is evident from all the groundwork he has already laid such as planting fodder. 

He will use the money he makes from the sale of milk to repay the loan and to cover dairy business related expenses. He stated that this diversification move is motivated by his determination to provide his daughter with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. Two of them are adults. One of them is a schoolboy. 

Saltanat has her own business. She has been busy with animal husbandry for three years. She buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. 

Saltanat has regular customers, thanks to her hard work. She manages with her business alone. Saltanat needs your financial support because her brother is ill. She is going to help him. She is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to buy medicines for the treatment of her brother. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treating her brother

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana de 56  años de edad vive con sus hijos  se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de pulpería sus  productos son arroz, azúcar, café, frescos, frijoles, jugos, agua purificada, etc. En su negocio también vende tortillas a sus clientes que son todos sus vecinos,  vive en el municipio  de San Lorenzo  Valle  al sur de Honduras es  una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
 Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, jabón, maíz, frescos, churros, leña, aceite etc. con el préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old and lives with her children. For the past 10 years she has made a living selling grocery products including rice, sugar, coffee, drinks, beans, juices, bottled water, etc. She also sells tortillas to her customers who are her neighbors. She lives in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with a desire to succeed, and she works hard every day to improve her quality of life.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, soap, corn, drinks, churros, firewood, oil, etc. With this loan, she aims to improve her income and quality of life. Her dream is to have a successful and well-stocked business, while improving her family’s future. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, soap, corn, drinks, churros, firewood, oil etc. for her store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 44 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 11, 18, and 21 years. In addition to her children, she lives with one of her relatives, whom she helps with her education.  

In 1993, Mariama established her grocery business, selling mainly mayonnaise, soft drinks, powdered milk, sardines, and sugar. She began her business to help take care of herself and her children. Working six days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Mariama would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase more sugar, soft drinks, sardines, and milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. 

In the future, Mariama plans to educate her children up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, soft drinks, sardines, and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen appliances such as a stove and a refrigerator for her home.

loans.name: Nông

texts.en:
Nông works in agriculture farming food.

She is 60 years old and married with three children. Nông supports one dependent. with her business in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nông's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nông has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having money to repair her latrine .She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her toilet and water tank.

In the future, Nông hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her toilet and water tank.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old, married, and has five children who attend school. For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces the challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 


Susan requested a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase meat goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase goats to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Regina is 48 years old and all of her children are in school.

Regina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Regina has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Regina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more onions, seasonings, tins of tomatoes, and cooking oil

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Nkubu, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. For the past 10 years, Stella has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Stella loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “Karemba.” Milking Karemba is her hobby and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Stella. She faces the challenge of irrigating her farm and providing water to her animals. Nkubu is a remote area without piped water or electricity. 

Since Stella is from a marginalized community, she is forced to walk long distances to search for water. She typically walks for two hours. Therefore, Stella is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the rain water in his area goes to waste and Stella wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. The loan will save Stella time and allow her to irrigate her farm during dry seasons and increase her productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide her with financial security. Stella will also use the stored water for home consumption. Stella’s dream is to increase her farming activities and provide her children with a proper education. Education is the only way that her children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, a 48-year- old mother of four, lives with her family in Balasan, Ilo-ilo. Her husband is a fisherman, and their children range in age from 33 to 18 years of age.

Elsie has been engaged in fishing for almost 20 years, selling her catch to members of her local community. She is requesting a loan of PhP 30,000 in order to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials that will help her to increase her catch. 

In the future, Elsie would like to expand her business enough to support the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her through her previous loan, as she was able to purchase more quantities of chicken and pork to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She now applies for another loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay for the additional stocks of chicken and pork that she needs in her business. The more chicken and pork displayed at her stall, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to become more successful in her business and she wants to have expansions too. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and pork for her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvul, 64, is a married woman and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy cow shed.

loans.name: Jonabe

texts.en:
A onabe , age 48, engages in fishing. She catches fresh fish and sells these to members of her local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost 2 years. Jonabe lives with her family in Carles, Ilo-ilo. She and her husband have two  children. Her husband is a fisherman. Their eldest child is 4 years old and the youngest is 7 month old. Jonabe is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy a pump boat and engine (for the motorboat).  These materials will help her to increase her ongoing catch. 

Jonabe  would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to a buy pumpboat and engine (for the motorboat)

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda has been operating a retail business in the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. For over four years, the business has been doing well. Her revenue from the business goes to their daily expenditures and home improvements. It helps her family a lot. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, and she hopes to have shelter for her store. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase additional grains and livestock feeding supplies in addition to her stock for sale. She wants to expand her business and to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grains and livestock feeding supplies in addition to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Moses Bai

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Moses Bai. He is single and has one child, age 7. In 2009, Moses Bai established his pharmacy business. He began his business as a way of becoming self-employed and to develop himself. His business is located in the outskirts of the city. 

Moses has just completed repayment on his first loan and now requires a second loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Moses Bai intends to use this loan to buy more medicines for his business. He hopes that this loan will help him attract more customers and enable him to stock his pharmacy with quality medicines.

Moses used proceeds from his last loan to support his child’s education and extend his pharmacy. This year, Moses’ child passed his end-of-year examination and was promoted from class two to class three.

Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, Moses Bai earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. In the future, he plans to further improve his business and provide a good education for his child.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Hayarpi

texts.en:
Hayarpi is an agronomist from Ashotavan village, Syunik region. She lives with her mother-in-law, husband and two childs (ages 7 and 4 years old). 

Hayarpi has been engaged in farming since she got married, for over 10 years. The farm includes three cows, calves, and 29 sheep. The orchard that is located near their house brings a major profit to the family. Hayarpi grows emmer wheat, potatoes and cabbage, and has nut, apple, and pear trees there. 

Hayarpi's family members help her a lot: her husband sells the gathered harvest in the market, and her mother-in-law assists with household activities. 
Now, wanting to invest in her farm and enlarge the production of fruit, Hayarpi asks this loan. She plans to use it on purchasing fertilizer, forage, and fuel for land cultivation. 

As this is Hayarpi's first loan; it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, forage, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: start a fruit and vegetable business, buy the stand in the photo, rent the premises, and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello! The above picture presents David, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest man. He is happily married and is blessed with two angels looking like children. Being still young and full of energy, he has been practicing farming for the past five years, and has been making profits. His farming involves feeding and attending to his animals. His primary source of income is selling eggs, maize, vegetables and some small business he does to make ends meet. When asked what’s the most enjoyable bit about farming he answered, “I get food to eat and to sell”. 

David has an expansive land, and has planted enough Napier grass. He has always wanted to buy a good dairy breed of cow, but the challenge he has been facing is a lack of finances. That is why he is seeking funds to make his dream a reality. Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, he will make his dream a reality because these institutions are all about helping small-scale farmers better their livelihood. He underwent training with Juhudi Kilimo, and has learned that microfinance helps the poor access financing and helps them in their projects. 

He says that through the loan, he will increase his milk production and therefore increase his income level. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and securing the future of his young family.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Marigres

texts.en:
Marigres is a 44-year-old married woman from Balasan, Ilo-ilo. She has nine children. The oldest is 23 years old, and the youngest is 3. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like eggs, sugar, bread, canned goods, shampoo, seasonings, and noodles. She has been operating a sari-sari store for more than 5 years now. Aside from operating a store, she engages in fishing. She sells fish as an additional source of income.

Marigres  requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy various merchandise like noodles, canned goods, toiletries, beverages, and fishing nets. This will help Marigres sell more merchandise as well as improve her catch.

In the future, Marigres would like to expand both of her businesses to provide her children with proper diets and quality educations.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise, such as noodles, canned goods, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with 13 children. Some of her children are grown, but five are still dependents and range in age from 7-17. 

Like most people in Carles, Jocelyn has been engaged in fishing together with her husband for many years now. She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo, an engine, adhesive, nylon, and plywood. 

She is motivated to work hard because of her children. Her income will be used for the family’s daily consumption, school fees, and reinvestment in the same business.
 
In the future, she hopes for her business to become more successful.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, an engine, adhesive, nylon, and plywood.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
	
For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is agronomist living in Zaritap village, Vayots Dzor region. She lives there with her husband and son. Both of them are employed in the private sector. Shoghik herself runs their family farm. She keeps livestock of cows, calves, and some hens. The main agricultural products that Shoghiik gets from her farm are milk, meat, and some eggs. 

Realizing how important farming is for family income, Shoghik would like to enlarge it. She asks for this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase two more calves for her livestock, and forage for feeding them.
 
As this is Shoghik's first loan; it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 

Please help this hardworking woman to continue her farming business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage for feeding the livestock

location.town: Zaritap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
This is Naira's second loan from Kiva. After paying her first loan back, Naira asks lenders to support her daughter's second year university tuition. 

Naira, as a very responsible borrower and caring mother, hopes for lenders' goodwill and support one more time.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit runs a small store on the first floor of the house where she lives. She lives with her husband and daughter, who help her to organize her trading business. The store includes a large variety of products and is profitable enough for ensuring the family has a stable income. 

Anahit now asks for this loan to be able to invest some funds in her store and increase the turnover. She plans to purchase new stock of supplies (food and home appliances) for her store. 

Anahit has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies (food and home appliances) for her store.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en: Yolly is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is 51 years old, and married with three grown children. Yolly and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for 26 years now. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 to buy a new engine for their fishing boat. This will assure them of continuous fishing and a better income in the future. Her profit will then be used for savings, healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Emilde

texts.en:
Emilde, age 46, operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like noodles, bread, seasonings, powder soap, canned goods, and beverages. She has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years. 

Emilde lives with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have seven children. Their eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is four. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 in order to buy a variety of merchandise, like soft drinks, seasonings, canned goods, and beverages. These merchandise will help her to increase her sales. 

In the future, Emilde  would like to expand her sari-sari store business enough to support the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchadise, like soft drinks, seasonings, canned goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Siznak village with her mother. Her mother works at a local cannery and Anna herself is a hairdresser. She works at a local beauty salon and is a very talented hairdresser with a loyal client base. 

Anna has applied for this loan to be able to purchase supplies needed for doing her job more effectively. 

She asks lenders to support her in purchasing a chair, tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing services. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Anna, with a good client history behind her, hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a chair, tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing services

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has successfully built her parlor business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business.

Now Salma is in her 10th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase packs of combs, brushes, hair care products, makeup kits, and lipsticks to deal to more customers at a time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase packs of combs, brushes, hair care products, makeup kits, and lipsticks to deal to more customers at a time to gain more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a corridor for her home.

loans.name: Elvira Elizabeth

texts.es: Elvira: Es una mujer amable, trabajadora, casada,  originaria de Puerto cabezas, tiene 5 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 9 años se dedica al acopio y venta de mariscos. Solicita financiamiento, para comprar mariscos e incrementar su producción. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Elvira is a friendly and hardworking woman who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has five children who are of school age. Her goal is to have her own source of income. For the past nine years, she has been acquiring and selling seafood.

Elvira is requesting a loan so that she can buy seafood and increase her production. Her dream is to have a concrete house.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a new client, age 34 years. She is married with four children ages 17, 15, 14, and 10 years old, and all of them attend school. 

Angella's major source of income is fish trading, as well as farming, majoring in coffee growing. She gives her business 8 hours a day to be able to get income to sustain her family. She started her business in Kyamuhunga, Igara, Bushenyi District. Her main objective for starting her business was to generate income to look after her family and educate her children. Her clients are all categories of people.

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 (Uganda shillings (UGX) to buy fish to sell in her business. Her biggest challenge is limited market and poor transport means, which affect her income negatively. Her future plan is to educate all of her children. She is a hardworking woman and this has helped her a lot in growing her business.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Muong Phang 7 Group

texts.en:
Pieng is an advanced-age woman who has lived in an old Thai traditional house with her husband and her sons, along with her daughter-in-law and a grandchild. She works as an officer in the Commune Women Union and is still very hard-working at agricultural productions such as raising pigs, fish, chickens and planting rice and vegetables.

Although Pieng currently has a stable life, she still worries about her children and grandchild because they have to struggle with financial difficulties. For that reason, Pieng decided to take out a loan in Anh Chi Em Program to support her family through taking capital for investment and benefit technical agriculture support from the Program. This is her first loan in Anh Chi Em and she will use the loan to buy small fish. 

Pieng dreams her grandchild will have a brighter future, a better and more abundant life than her and her parents. In the picture, Pieng stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo tiene 55 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace ya 30 años y vive con su esposa tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen de él.
Don Guillermo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar  ya que en la comunidad donde vive no poseen servicio de alumbrando eléctrico y espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y a su vez está contento porque contribuirá a conservar el medio ambiente.
Uno de sus sueños es tener la luz en su hogar.  


Trojes, Honduras-  Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo is 55 years old and lives in the community of Trojes in eastern Honduras. He has been engaged in agriculture and livestock breeding for 30 years. Guillermo lives with his wife and they have four children who are dependent on him.

Don Guillermo is requesting a loan in order to buy a solar energy system. In the community where they live, there is no lighting or electricity service. He hopes this investment will gradually improve his quality of life and that of his family. In addition, he is pleased that he can contribute to the preservation of the environment.

One of his dreams is to have electricity in his home.

Trojes, Honduras – September 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna lives in Kapan, Syunik region with her husband and daughter. Her husband is an army officer, and her daughter is school-aged. Inna has been working at a beauty salon for many years.

Over years of hard and tireless work, Inna was able to earn a good reputation as a talented hairdresser and gain a good client base. Inna has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials for providing hairdressing services. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing hairdressing services.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
This young woman from Kapan city, of the Syunik region, is engaged in a clothing sales business. Now, Mari wants to enlarge her business with the help of a Kiva loan. 

In one of the small rooms in her house, she sells a very nice assortment of women's clothes, bedding, covers, and towels. As a result of this, she has a great number of loyal customers, whom she is always happy and ready to help with choices among the great variety. 

Mari lives with her mother and sister. Her mother helps Mari in her business, especially in the process of bringing new products for her trading business. 

Now, Mari asks for this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing for the winter season. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Rosa Marleni

texts.es: Rosa tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad. Rosa posee una pequeña tienda y además trabaja en una panadería lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su familia. Rosa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y para pagar mano de obra necesaria para la reparación del techo de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and resides in her own home along with her 12-year-old son. She has a small store and also works in a bakery in order to sustain her household.

Rosa is a hardworking and committed woman who does everything in her power to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, and nails. Rosa will also pay for the necessary labor to have the roof of her house repaired.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Edrian

texts.en:
Edrian is 25 years old and comes from the town of Carles, Iloilo.  He is married with a two-year-old daughter. For two years now, he has been engaged in fishing and a sari-sari (variety) store business. He is asking for a loan to buy  fishing nets and also canned corned beef, sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, and bath soap.

Edrian hopes that this will make his business more attractive to customers and he will earn better. 

In the future, he hopes to live a prosperous life and be successful in sending his child to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and also canned corned beef, sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, and bath soap

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is an entrepreneur who took the initiative to start a business selling shoes for women to support her family and help them get ahead.

She thinks that her business is doing well due to her dedication; she works ten hours a day. She is the main breadwinner of her family because her husband died some years ago and she is a widow. Her son is 22 years old but he has no source of income yet. She has managed with this business alone for 10 years.

She is going to buy a new selection of women's shoes for the autumn season. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's shoes for the new season

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She brings up three children. Her husband works in a factory. 

Nigora has experienced a lot of difficulties in her life. She divorced at age 19 with two little children. She was married a second time when she was 26 years old. She works hard to earn a living. 

Nigora makes clothes. She makes a variety of different items of clothing. She works in a workshop. Nigora has been busy with this business for more than 14 years. She has her regular clients.  

She has decided to request a loan from IMON in order to buy an embroidery machine for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary level education. She makes a living by baking flat-bread, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income and which she learned when she was young, by helping her mother. 

Muhabbat started her own business in 1999 and she has developed it since then. She has a tandoor oven, some tables, and she uses charcoal, as opposed to wood, as she cares about the environment. She sells her flat-breads herself at the local market and they are so hot and delicious that she receives a high demand for them from regular customers. 

Muhabbat is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy flour for making more flat-breads and, in this way, to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

She plans to use the profits from her loan to further develop her business and to build a large bakery shop.

loans.use: To buy flour for making more flat-bread

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children, all of whom go to school. Her greatest expenses are food and school fees.

She has been in her farming business for the past ten years. Her main challenges with the business are seasonality and transportation.
 
Florence is taking a loan of KES 80,000 to invest in her farming business. With the loan, Florence plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming.  She decided to join Yehu to be able to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 47-year-old woman, married to Samuel who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with four children. Beatrice is a farmer who has been an operating agricultural business for the past five years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Beatrice was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 20,000. She intends to use this to buy seedlings and cultivate the farm.

Beatrice plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and cultivate the farm.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 39 años de edad, estudio bachillerato. Actualmente esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Ellos están estudiando y con él viven sus dos hijos y su esposa. 

Manuel es empleado trabaja desde hace 10 años en una Universidad privada. Años atrás fue militar. Su trabajo le queda a una hora de camino y viaja en bus urbano. Su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un terreno que esta a la par de su casa y poderla ampliar. Sus sueños son tener una vivienda en buen estado y así vivir más cómodos con su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 39 years old and has a high school diploma. He is currently married and has two children who are in school. He lives with his two children and his wife. 

Manuel has been an employee working at a private university for 10 years, and years ago he was in the military. His job is an hour away and he takes the city bus. His work hours are from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

He is requesting the loan to buy land on the same level of his house and be able to expand it. His dreams are to have a home in good condition, and thus live more comfortable with his family.

loans.use: to buy land on the same level of his house and be able to expand it.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, 62, has twenty years of experience in farming. He is from Mugwe village located in Central Province of Kenya. With the help of a loving wife, he heads a family of five children. He is able to provide for such a big family by engaging in mixed farming and a transportation business, pension, and personal business. His main income sources from the farm are milk, eggs, tea, and other crops such as vegetables. 

Johnson lacks funding to scale up his dairy business. The demand for milk is overwhelming, but he only has so much he can supply. He is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. With a greater number of cows, he is bound to produce more milk and mitigate risks such as temporary shortages. 

The increase in income from the acquired cow will come in handy at this moment that he is dealing with high school fees expenses. He stated, "My family will greatly appreciate anyone out there who is going to contribute to an increase in our family income."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en: Sem’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sem works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en: Savoeun’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Savoeun works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel his house.

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: Oeun’s group live in a rural village in Kadal province in Cambodia. Oeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and seller buy selling porridge to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: Sim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor, village coordinator, musician, garbage collection laborer and​​ electronic laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokhom works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Alvaro habitante de Ticuantepe, casado, padre de un hijo, trabajador, tiene 43 años de edad y con grandes deseos de superación.
el solicita este crédito para la compra de Materiales como bloques, cemento, arena, hierro ya que su vivienda esta cerrada con Zinc y quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que el siente una gran inseguridad por el temor que en un mal tiempo pueda caerse o algún ladrón llevarse las pocas cosas que tiene
muy agradecido don Alvaro espera seguir trabajando con Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Alvaro lives in Ticuantepe, is married, the father of one child, a hard worker, 43 years old, and is eager to succeed. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as blocks, cement, sand, and iron, since his home is enclosed with Zinc, and he wants to improve his living conditions. He feels insecure knowing that with bad weather his home may collapse, or a thief could steal the few things that he has. Alvaro is very grateful and looks forward to working with Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad, es una señora dedicada a los oficios del hogar, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, actualmente de nueve hijos solo viven con ella 3 hijos y 3 nietos, de los cuales solo dos estudian y los demás realizan trabajos agrícolas. María solo se dedica a los oficios del hogar realizando la alimentación de sus hijos, la limpieza y otros trabajos.

El préstamo será utilizado para pagar una deuda, ya que es demasiado el interés que le cobran y necesita tener un mejor servicio como lo ofrece Credicampo. María quiere que sus hijos estudien y sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
María, age 47, devotes herself to the household chores, and she has help from her children.  Of her nine children, only three of them and three grandchildren live with her.  Only two go to school, and the others do agricultural work.  María only does the household chores.  She makes her children’s food, cleans, and does other jobs.

The loan will be used to pay a debt.  The interest they charge is too much, and she needs to have a better service, like CrediCampo offers.  María wants her children to go to school and become professionals

loans.use: to pay a debt.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam: Es una mujer sociable y luchadora, casada. Desde hace 19 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera, con 6 personas. Solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera y comprar poste y clavos. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería.
texts.en: Miriam is a sociable woman and a fighter, and is married. She has lived in a For 19 years lives in a wooden dairy farm with 6 people. She is requesting a loan to change the wood and to buy nails and posts. Her dream is to establish a grocery store.

loans.use: to replace the wood in her home and buy nails and posts.
